summary.long: Genesis is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth was without form and void, and darkness was over the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God was hovering over the face of the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let there be light,” and there was light.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And God saw that the light was good. And God separated the light from the darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God called the light Day, and the darkness he called Night. And there was evening and there was morning, the first day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let there be an expanse in the midst of the waters, and let it separate the waters from the waters.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And God made the expanse and separated the waters that were under the expanse from the waters that were above the expanse. And it was so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God called the expanse Heaven. And there was evening and there was morning, the second day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let the waters under the heavens be gathered together into one place, and let the dry land appear.” And it was so.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: God called the dry land Earth, and the waters that were gathered together he called Seas. And God saw that it was good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let the earth sprout vegetation, plants yielding seed, and fruit trees bearing fruit in which is their seed, each according to its kind, on the earth.” And it was so.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: The earth brought forth vegetation, plants yielding seed according to their own kinds, and trees bearing fruit in which is their seed, each according to its kind. And God saw that it was good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was evening and there was morning, the third day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let there be lights in the expanse of the heavens to separate the day from the night. And let them be for signs and for seasons, and for days and years,
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: and let them be lights in the expanse of the heavens to give light upon the earth.” And it was so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God made the two great lights—the greater light to rule the day and the lesser light to rule the night—and the stars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God set them in the expanse of the heavens to give light on the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to rule over the day and over the night, and to separate the light from the darkness. And God saw that it was good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was evening and there was morning, the fourth day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let the waters swarm with swarms of living creatures, and let birds fly above the earth across the expanse of the heavens.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: So God created the great sea creatures and every living creature that moves, with which the waters swarm, according to their kinds, and every winged bird according to its kind. And God saw that it was good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God blessed them, saying, “Be fruitful and multiply and fill the waters in the seas, and let birds multiply on the earth.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And there was evening and there was morning, the fifth day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let the earth bring forth living creatures according to their kinds—livestock and creeping things and beasts of the earth according to their kinds.” And it was so.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And God made the beasts of the earth according to their kinds and the livestock according to their kinds, and everything that creeps on the ground according to its kind. And God saw that it was good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God said, “Let us make man in our image, after our likeness. And let them have dominion over the fish of the sea and over the birds of the heavens and over the livestock and over all the earth and over every creeping thing that creeps on the earth.”
verses.speaker: God
Narrator

verses.text: And God blessed them. And God said to them, “Be fruitful and multiply and fill the earth and subdue it, and have dominion over the fish of the sea and over the birds of the heavens and over every living thing that moves on the earth.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And God said, “Behold, I have given you every plant yielding seed that is on the face of all the earth, and every tree with seed in its fruit. You shall have them for food.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And to every beast of the earth and to every bird of the heavens and to everything that creeps on the earth, everything that has the breath of life, I have given every green plant for food.” And it was so.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And God saw everything that he had made, and behold, it was very good. And there was evening and there was morning, the sixth day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the heavens and the earth were finished, and all the host of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the seventh day God finished his work that he had done, and he rested on the seventh day from all his work that he had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So God blessed the seventh day and made it holy, because on it God rested from all his work that he had done in creation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These are the generations
of the heavens and the earth when they were created,
in the day that the Lord God made the earth and the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When no bush of the field was yet in the land and no small plant of the field had yet sprung up—for the Lord God had not caused it to rain on the land, and there was no man to work the ground,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a mist was going up from the land and was watering the whole face of the ground—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the Lord God formed the man of dust from the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living creature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord God planted a garden in Eden, in the east, and there he put the man whom he had formed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And out of the ground the Lord God made to spring up every tree that is pleasant to the sight and good for food. The tree of life was in the midst of the garden, and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A river flowed out of Eden to water the garden, and there it divided and became four rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of the first is the Pishon. It is the one that flowed around the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the gold of that land is good; bdellium and onyx stone are there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of the second river is the Gihon. It is the one that flowed around the whole land of Cush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the name of the third river is the Tigris, which flows east of Assyria. And the fourth river is the Euphrates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord God took the man and put him in the garden of Eden to work it and keep it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord God commanded the man, saying, “You may surely eat of every tree of the garden,
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: but of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil you shall not eat, for in the day that you eat of it you shall surely die.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Then the Lord God said, “It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him a helper fit for him.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Now out of the ground the Lord God had formed every beast of the field and every bird of the heavens and brought them to the man to see what he would call them. And whatever the man called every living creature, that was its name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man gave names to all livestock and to the birds of the heavens and to every beast of the field. But for Adam there was not found a helper fit for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord God caused a deep sleep to fall upon the man, and while he slept took one of his ribs and closed up its place with flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the rib that the Lord God had taken from the man he made into a woman and brought her to the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the man said,
“This at last is bone of my bones
    and flesh of my flesh;
she shall be called Woman,
    because she was taken out of Man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore a man shall leave his father and his mother and hold fast to his wife, and they shall become one flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man and his wife were both naked and were not ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now the serpent was more crafty than any other beast of the field that the Lord God had made.
He said to the woman, “Did God actually say, ‘You shall not eat of any tree in the garden’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the woman said to the serpent, “We may eat of the fruit of the trees in the garden,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but God said, ‘You shall not eat of the fruit of the tree that is in the midst of the garden, neither shall you touch it, lest you die.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the serpent said to the woman, “You will not surely die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God knows that when you eat of it your eyes will be opened, and you will be like God, knowing good and evil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was a delight to the eyes, and that the tree was to be desired to make one wise, she took of its fruit and ate, and she also gave some to her husband who was with her, and he ate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the eyes of both were opened, and they knew that they were naked. And they sewed fig leaves together and made themselves loincloths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they heard the sound of the Lord God walking in the garden in the cool of the day, and the man and his wife hid themselves from the presence of the Lord God among the trees of the garden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord God called to the man and said to him, “Where are you?”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And he said, “I heard the sound of you in the garden, and I was afraid, because I was naked, and I hid myself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Who told you that you were naked? Have you eaten of the tree of which I commanded you not to eat?”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: The man said, “The woman whom you gave to be with me, she gave me fruit of the tree, and I ate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord God said to the woman, “What is this that you have done?” The woman said, “The serpent deceived me, and I ate.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text:
The Lord God said to the serpent,
“Because you have done this,
    cursed are you above all livestock
    and above all beasts of the field;
on your belly you shall go,
    and dust you shall eat
    all the days of your life.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text:
I will put enmity between you and the woman,
    and between your offspring and her offspring;
he shall bruise your head,
    and you shall bruise his heel.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text:
To the woman he said,
“I will surely multiply your pain in childbearing;
    in pain you shall bring forth children.
Your desire shall be contrary to your husband,
    but he shall rule over you.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text:
And to Adam he said,
“Because you have listened to the voice of your wife
    and have eaten of the tree
of which I commanded you,
    ‘You shall not eat of it,’
cursed is the ground because of you;
    in pain you shall eat of it all the days of your life;
verses.speaker: God

verses.text:
thorns and thistles it shall bring forth for you;
    and you shall eat the plants of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator
God

verses.text: The man called his wife's name Eve, because she was the mother of all living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord God made for Adam and for his wife garments of skins and clothed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord God said, “Behold, the man has become like one of us in knowing good and evil. Now, lest he reach out his hand and take also of the tree of life and eat, and live forever—”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: therefore the Lord God sent him out from the garden of Eden to work the ground from which he was taken.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: He drove out the man, and at the east of the garden of Eden he placed the cherubim and a flaming sword that turned every way to guard the way to the tree of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Adam knew Eve his wife, and she conceived and bore Cain, saying, “I have gotten a man with the help of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again, she bore his brother Abel. Now Abel was a keeper of sheep, and Cain a worker of the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the course of time Cain brought to the Lord an offering of the fruit of the ground,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Abel also brought of the firstborn of his flock and of their fat portions. And the Lord had regard for Abel and his offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but for Cain and his offering he had no regard. So Cain was very angry, and his face fell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Cain, “Why are you angry, and why has your face fallen?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do well, will you not be accepted? And if you do not do well, sin is crouching at the door. Its desire is contrary to you, but you must rule over it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cain spoke to Abel his brother. And when they were in the field, Cain rose up against his brother Abel and killed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Cain, “Where is Abel your brother?” He said, “I do not know; am I my brother's keeper?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, “What have you done? The voice of your brother's blood is crying to me from the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now you are cursed from the ground, which has opened its mouth to receive your brother's blood from your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you work the ground, it shall no longer yield to you its strength. You shall be a fugitive and a wanderer on the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cain said to the Lord, “My punishment is greater than I can bear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, you have driven me today away from the ground, and from your face I shall be hidden. I shall be a fugitive and a wanderer on the earth, and whoever finds me will kill me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to him, “Not so! If anyone kills Cain, vengeance shall be taken on him sevenfold.” And the Lord put a mark on Cain, lest any who found him should attack him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Cain went away from the presence of the Lord and settled in the land of Nod, east of Eden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cain knew his wife, and she conceived and bore Enoch. When he built a city, he called the name of the city after the name of his son, Enoch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Enoch was born Irad, and Irad fathered Mehujael, and Mehujael fathered Methushael, and Methushael fathered Lamech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Lamech took two wives. The name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adah bore Jabal; he was the father of those who dwell in tents and have livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His brother's name was Jubal; he was the father of all those who play the lyre and pipe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zillah also bore Tubal-cain; he was the forger of all instruments of bronze and iron. The sister of Tubal-cain was Naamah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lamech said to his wives:
“Adah and Zillah, hear my voice;
    you wives of Lamech, listen to what I say:
I have killed a man for wounding me,
    a young man for striking me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If Cain's revenge is sevenfold,
    then Lamech's is seventy-sevenfold.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Adam knew his wife again, and she bore a son and called his name Seth, for she said, “God has appointed for me another offspring instead of Abel, for Cain killed him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Seth also a son was born, and he called his name Enosh. At that time people began to call upon the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the book of the generations of Adam. When God created man, he made him in the likeness of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Male and female he created them, and he blessed them and named them Man when they were created.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Adam had lived 130 years, he fathered a son in his own likeness, after his image, and named him Seth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The days of Adam after he fathered Seth were 800 years; and he had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus all the days that Adam lived were 930 years, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Seth had lived 105 years, he fathered Enosh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seth lived after he fathered Enosh 807 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus all the days of Seth were 912 years, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Enosh had lived 90 years, he fathered Kenan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Enosh lived after he fathered Kenan 815 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus all the days of Enosh were 905 years, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Kenan had lived 70 years, he fathered Mahalalel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kenan lived after he fathered Mahalalel 840 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus all the days of Kenan were 910 years, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Mahalalel had lived 65 years, he fathered Jared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mahalalel lived after he fathered Jared 830 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus all the days of Mahalalel were 895 years, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jared had lived 162 years, he fathered Enoch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jared lived after he fathered Enoch 800 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus all the days of Jared were 962 years, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Enoch had lived 65 years, he fathered Methuselah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Enoch walked with God after he fathered Methuselah 300 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus all the days of Enoch were 365 years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Enoch walked with God, and he was not, for God took him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Methuselah had lived 187 years, he fathered Lamech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Methuselah lived after he fathered Lamech 782 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus all the days of Methuselah were 969 years, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Lamech had lived 182 years, he fathered a son
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and called his name Noah, saying, “Out of the ground that the Lord has cursed, this one shall bring us relief from our work and from the painful toil of our hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lamech lived after he fathered Noah 595 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus all the days of Lamech were 777 years, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Noah was 500 years old, Noah fathered Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When man began to multiply on the face of the land and daughters were born to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sons of God saw that the daughters of man were attractive. And they took as their wives any they chose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “My Spirit shall not abide in man forever, for he is flesh: his days shall be 120 years.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Nephilim were on the earth in those days, and also afterward, when the sons of God came in to the daughters of man and they bore children to them. These were the mighty men who were of old, the men of renown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every intention of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord regretted that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him to his heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said, “I will blot out man whom I have created from the face of the land, man and animals and creeping things and birds of the heavens, for I am sorry that I have made them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Noah found favor in the eyes of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the generations of Noah. Noah was a righteous man, blameless in his generation. Noah walked with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Noah had three sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the earth was corrupt in God's sight, and the earth was filled with violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God saw the earth, and behold, it was corrupt, for all flesh had corrupted their way on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said to Noah, “I have determined to make an end of all flesh, for the earth is filled with violence through them. Behold, I will destroy them with the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make yourself an ark of gopher wood. Make rooms in the ark, and cover it inside and out with pitch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how you are to make it: the length of the ark 300 cubits, its breadth 50 cubits, and its height 30 cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make a roof for the ark, and finish it to a cubit above, and set the door of the ark in its side. Make it with lower, second, and third decks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, I will bring a flood of waters upon the earth to destroy all flesh in which is the breath of life under heaven. Everything that is on the earth shall die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will establish my covenant with you, and you shall come into the ark, you, your sons, your wife, and your sons' wives with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of every living thing of all flesh, you shall bring two of every sort into the ark to keep them alive with you. They shall be male and female.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the birds according to their kinds, and of the animals according to their kinds, of every creeping thing of the ground, according to its kind, two of every sort shall come in to you to keep them alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also take with you every sort of food that is eaten, and store it up. It shall serve as food for you and for them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Noah did this; he did all that God commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Noah, “Go into the ark, you and all your household, for I have seen that you are righteous before me in this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take with you seven pairs of all clean animals, the male and his mate, and a pair of the animals that are not clean, the male and his mate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and seven pairs of the birds of the heavens also, male and female, to keep their offspring alive on the face of all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in seven days I will send rain on the earth forty days and forty nights, and every living thing that I have made I will blot out from the face of the ground.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Noah did all that the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters came upon the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Noah and his sons and his wife and his sons' wives with him went into the ark to escape the waters of the flood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of clean animals, and of animals that are not clean, and of birds, and of everything that creeps on the ground,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: two and two, male and female, went into the ark with Noah, as God had commanded Noah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after seven days the waters of the flood came upon the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the six hundredth year of Noah's life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on that day all the fountains of the great deep burst forth, and the windows of the heavens were opened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And rain fell upon the earth forty days and forty nights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the very same day Noah and his sons, Shem and Ham and Japheth, and Noah's wife and the three wives of his sons with them entered the ark,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they and every beast, according to its kind, and all the livestock according to their kinds, and every creeping thing that creeps on the earth, according to its kind, and every bird, according to its kind, every winged creature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went into the ark with Noah, two and two of all flesh in which there was the breath of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those that entered, male and female of all flesh, went in as God had commanded him. And the Lord shut him in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The flood continued forty days on the earth. The waters increased and bore up the ark, and it rose high above the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The waters prevailed and increased greatly on the earth, and the ark floated on the face of the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the waters prevailed so mightily on the earth that all the high mountains under the whole heaven were covered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The waters prevailed above the mountains, covering them fifteen cubits deep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all flesh died that moved on the earth, birds, livestock, beasts, all swarming creatures that swarm on the earth, and all mankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything on the dry land in whose nostrils was the breath of life died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He blotted out every living thing that was on the face of the ground, man and animals and creeping things and birds of the heavens. They were blotted out from the earth. Only Noah was left, and those who were with him in the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the waters prevailed on the earth 150 days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God remembered Noah and all the beasts and all the livestock that were with him in the ark. And God made a wind blow over the earth, and the waters subsided.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fountains of the deep and the windows of the heavens were closed, the rain from the heavens was restrained,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the waters receded from the earth continually. At the end of 150 days the waters had abated,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, the ark came to rest on the mountains of Ararat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the waters continued to abate until the tenth month; in the tenth month, on the first day of the month, the tops of the mountains were seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the end of forty days Noah opened the window of the ark that he had made
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sent forth a raven. It went to and fro until the waters were dried up from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he sent forth a dove from him, to see if the waters had subsided from the face of the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the dove found no place to set her foot, and she returned to him to the ark, for the waters were still on the face of the whole earth. So he put out his hand and took her and brought her into the ark with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He waited another seven days, and again he sent forth the dove out of the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the dove came back to him in the evening, and behold, in her mouth was a freshly plucked olive leaf. So Noah knew that the waters had subsided from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he waited another seven days and sent forth the dove, and she did not return to him anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the six hundred and first year, in the first month, the first day of the month, the waters were dried from off the earth. And Noah removed the covering of the ark and looked, and behold, the face of the ground was dry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, the earth had dried out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God said to Noah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go out from the ark, you and your wife, and your sons and your sons' wives with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring out with you every living thing that is with you of all flesh—birds and animals and every creeping thing that creeps on the earth—that they may swarm on the earth, and be fruitful and multiply on the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Noah went out, and his sons and his wife and his sons' wives with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every beast, every creeping thing, and every bird, everything that moves on the earth, went out by families from the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Noah built an altar to the Lord and took some of every clean animal and some of every clean bird and offered burnt offerings on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Lord smelled the pleasing aroma, the Lord said in his heart, “I will never again curse the ground because of man, for the intention of man's heart is evil from his youth. Neither will I ever again strike down every living creature as I have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the earth remains, seedtime and harvest, cold and heat, summer and winter, day and night, shall not cease.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God blessed Noah and his sons and said to them, “Be fruitful and multiply and fill the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fear of you and the dread of you shall be upon every beast of the earth and upon every bird of the heavens, upon everything that creeps on the ground and all the fish of the sea. Into your hand they are delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every moving thing that lives shall be food for you. And as I gave you the green plants, I give you everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you shall not eat flesh with its life, that is, its blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for your lifeblood I will require a reckoning: from every beast I will require it and from man. From his fellow man I will require a reckoning for the life of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Whoever sheds the blood of man,
    by man shall his blood be shed,
for God made man in his own image.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, be fruitful and multiply, increase greatly on the earth and multiply in it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God said to Noah and to his sons with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I establish my covenant with you and your offspring after you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with every living creature that is with you, the birds, the livestock, and every beast of the earth with you, as many as came out of the ark; it is for every beast of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I establish my covenant with you, that never again shall all flesh be cut off by the waters of the flood, and never again shall there be a flood to destroy the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “This is the sign of the covenant that I make between me and you and every living creature that is with you, for all future generations:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have set my bow in the cloud, and it shall be a sign of the covenant between me and the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I bring clouds over the earth and the bow is seen in the clouds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will remember my covenant that is between me and you and every living creature of all flesh. And the waters shall never again become a flood to destroy all flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the bow is in the clouds, I will see it and remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that is on the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God said to Noah, “This is the sign of the covenant that I have established between me and all flesh that is on the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Noah who went forth from the ark were Shem, Ham, and Japheth. (Ham was the father of Canaan.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These three were the sons of Noah, and from these the people of the whole earth were dispersed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Noah began to be a man of the soil, and he planted a vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He drank of the wine and became drunk and lay uncovered in his tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father and told his two brothers outside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Shem and Japheth took a garment, laid it on both their shoulders, and walked backward and covered the nakedness of their father. Their faces were turned backward, and they did not see their father's nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Noah awoke from his wine and knew what his youngest son had done to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
May God enlarge Japheth,
    and let him dwell in the tents of Shem,
    and let Canaan be his servant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the flood Noah lived 350 years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the days of Noah were 950 years, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the generations of the sons of Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Sons were born to them after the flood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From these the coastland peoples spread in their lands, each with his own language, by their clans, in their nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ham: Cush, Egypt, Put, and Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca. The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cush fathered Nimrod; he was the first on earth to be a mighty man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was a mighty hunter before the Lord. Therefore it is said, “Like Nimrod a mighty hunter before the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The beginning of his kingdom was Babel, Erech, Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that land he went into Assyria and built Nineveh, Rehoboth-Ir, Calah, and
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Resen between Nineveh and Calah; that is the great city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Egypt fathered Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pathrusim, Casluhim (from whom the Philistines came), and Caphtorim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canaan fathered Sidon his firstborn and Heth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites. Afterward the clans of the Canaanites dispersed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the territory of the Canaanites extended from Sidon in the direction of Gerar as far as Gaza, and in the direction of Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, as far as Lasha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Ham, by their clans, their languages, their lands, and their nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Shem also, the father of all the children of Eber, the elder brother of Japheth, children were born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, and Aram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arpachshad fathered Shelah; and Shelah fathered Eber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Eber were born two sons: the name of the one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided, and his brother's name was Joktan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joktan fathered Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab; all these were the sons of Joktan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The territory in which they lived extended from Mesha in the direction of Sephar to the hill country of the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Shem, by their clans, their languages, their lands, and their nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the clans of the sons of Noah, according to their genealogies, in their nations, and from these the nations spread abroad on the earth after the flood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the whole earth had one language and the same words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as people migrated from the east, they found a plain in the land of Shinar and settled there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to one another, “Come, let us make bricks, and burn them thoroughly.” And they had brick for stone, and bitumen for mortar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said, “Come, let us build ourselves a city and a tower with its top in the heavens, and let us make a name for ourselves, lest we be dispersed over the face of the whole earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of man had built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, “Behold, they are one people, and they have all one language, and this is only the beginning of what they will do. And nothing that they propose to do will now be impossible for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come, let us go down and there confuse their language, so that they may not understand one another's speech.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord dispersed them from there over the face of all the earth, and they left off building the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore its name was called Babel, because there the Lord confused the language of all the earth. And from there the Lord dispersed them over the face of all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the generations of Shem. When Shem was 100 years old, he fathered Arpachshad two years after the flood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Shem lived after he fathered Arpachshad 500 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Arpachshad had lived 35 years, he fathered Shelah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Arpachshad lived after he fathered Shelah 403 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Shelah had lived 30 years, he fathered Eber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Shelah lived after he fathered Eber 403 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Eber had lived 34 years, he fathered Peleg.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Eber lived after he fathered Peleg 430 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peleg had lived 30 years, he fathered Reu.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peleg lived after he fathered Reu 209 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Reu had lived 32 years, he fathered Serug.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Reu lived after he fathered Serug 207 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Serug had lived 30 years, he fathered Nahor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Serug lived after he fathered Nahor 200 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Nahor had lived 29 years, he fathered Terah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Nahor lived after he fathered Terah 119 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Terah had lived 70 years, he fathered Abram, Nahor, and Haran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the generations of Terah. Terah fathered Abram, Nahor, and Haran; and Haran fathered Lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Haran died in the presence of his father Terah in the land of his kindred, in Ur of the Chaldeans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abram and Nahor took wives. The name of Abram's wife was Sarai, and the name of Nahor's wife, Milcah, the daughter of Haran the father of Milcah and Iscah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Sarai was barren; she had no child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Terah took Abram his son and Lot the son of Haran, his grandson, and Sarai his daughter-in-law, his son Abram's wife, and they went forth together from Ur of the Chaldeans to go into the land of Canaan, but when they came to Haran, they settled there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The days of Terah were 205 years, and Terah died in Haran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord said to Abram, “Go from your country and your kindred and your father's house to the land that I will show you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will make of you a great nation, and I will bless you and make your name great, so that you will be a blessing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bless those who bless you, and him who dishonors you I will curse, and in you all the families of the earth shall be blessed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abram went, as the Lord had told him, and Lot went with him. Abram was seventy-five years old when he departed from Haran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abram took Sarai his wife, and Lot his brother's son, and all their possessions that they had gathered, and the people that they had acquired in Haran, and they set out to go to the land of Canaan. When they came to the land of Canaan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abram passed through the land to the place at Shechem, to the oak of Moreh. At that time the Canaanites were in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord appeared to Abram and said, “To your offspring I will give this land.” So he built there an altar to the Lord, who had appeared to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there he moved to the hill country on the east of Bethel and pitched his tent, with Bethel on the west and Ai on the east. And there he built an altar to the Lord and called upon the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abram journeyed on, still going toward the Negeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a famine in the land. So Abram went down to Egypt to sojourn there, for the famine was severe in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was about to enter Egypt, he said to Sarai his wife, “I know that you are a woman beautiful in appearance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when the Egyptians see you, they will say, ‘This is his wife.’ Then they will kill me, but they will let you live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say you are my sister, that it may go well with me because of you, and that my life may be spared for your sake.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Abram entered Egypt, the Egyptians saw that the woman was very beautiful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the princes of Pharaoh saw her, they praised her to Pharaoh. And the woman was taken into Pharaoh's house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for her sake he dealt well with Abram; and he had sheep, oxen, male donkeys, male servants, female servants, female donkeys, and camels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord afflicted Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai, Abram's wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pharaoh called Abram and said, “What is this you have done to me? Why did you not tell me that she was your wife?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why did you say, ‘She is my sister,’ so that I took her for my wife? Now then, here is your wife; take her, and go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh gave men orders concerning him, and they sent him away with his wife and all that he had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abram went up from Egypt, he and his wife and all that he had, and Lot with him, into the Negeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Abram was very rich in livestock, in silver, and in gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he journeyed on from the Negeb as far as Bethel to the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between Bethel and Ai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the place where he had made an altar at the first. And there Abram called upon the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Lot, who went with Abram, also had flocks and herds and tents,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the land could not support both of them dwelling together; for their possessions were so great that they could not dwell together,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there was strife between the herdsmen of Abram's livestock and the herdsmen of Lot's livestock. At that time the Canaanites and the Perizzites were dwelling in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abram said to Lot, “Let there be no strife between you and me, and between your herdsmen and my herdsmen, for we are kinsmen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not the whole land before you? Separate yourself from me. If you take the left hand, then I will go to the right, or if you take the right hand, then I will go to the left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Lot lifted up his eyes and saw that the Jordan Valley was well watered everywhere like the garden of the Lord, like the land of Egypt, in the direction of Zoar. (This was before the Lord destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Lot chose for himself all the Jordan Valley, and Lot journeyed east. Thus they separated from each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abram settled in the land of Canaan, while Lot settled among the cities of the valley and moved his tent as far as Sodom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the men of Sodom were wicked, great sinners against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Abram, after Lot had separated from him, “Lift up your eyes and look from the place where you are, northward and southward and eastward and westward,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for all the land that you see I will give to you and to your offspring forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make your offspring as the dust of the earth, so that if one can count the dust of the earth, your offspring also can be counted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arise, walk through the length and the breadth of the land, for I will give it to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abram moved his tent and came and settled by the oaks of Mamre, which are at Hebron, and there he built an altar to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the days of Amraphel king of Shinar, Arioch king of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of Goiim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: these kings made war with Bera king of Sodom, Birsha king of Gomorrah, Shinab king of Admah, Shemeber king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (that is, Zoar).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all these joined forces in the Valley of Siddim (that is, the Salt Sea).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Twelve years they had served Chedorlaomer, but in the thirteenth year they rebelled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fourteenth year Chedorlaomer and the kings who were with him came and defeated the Rephaim in Ashteroth-karnaim, the Zuzim in Ham, the Emim in Shaveh-kiriathaim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Horites in their hill country of Seir as far as El-paran on the border of the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they turned back and came to En-mishpat (that is, Kadesh) and defeated all the country of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites who were dwelling in Hazazon-tamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Sodom, the king of Gomorrah, the king of Admah, the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (that is, Zoar) went out, and they joined battle in the Valley of Siddim
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with Chedorlaomer king of Elam, Tidal king of Goiim, Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar, four kings against five.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Valley of Siddim was full of bitumen pits, and as the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled, some fell into them, and the rest fled to the hill country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the enemy took all the possessions of Sodom and Gomorrah, and all their provisions, and went their way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also took Lot, the son of Abram's brother, who was dwelling in Sodom, and his possessions, and went their way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one who had escaped came and told Abram the Hebrew, who was living by the oaks of Mamre the Amorite, brother of Eshcol and of Aner. These were allies of Abram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Abram heard that his kinsman had been taken captive, he led forth his trained men, born in his house, 318 of them, and went in pursuit as far as Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he divided his forces against them by night, he and his servants, and defeated them and pursued them to Hobah, north of Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought back all the possessions, and also brought back his kinsman Lot with his possessions, and the women and the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After his return from the defeat of Chedorlaomer and the kings who were with him, the king of Sodom went out to meet him at the Valley of Shaveh (that is, the King's Valley).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Melchizedek king of Salem brought out bread and wine. (He was priest of God Most High.)
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
and blessed be God Most High,
    who has delivered your enemies into your hand!”
And Abram gave him a tenth of everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king of Sodom said to Abram, “Give me the persons, but take the goods for yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abram said to the king of Sodom, “I have lifted my hand to the Lord, God Most High, Possessor of heaven and earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that I would not take a thread or a sandal strap or anything that is yours, lest you should say, ‘I have made Abram rich.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will take nothing but what the young men have eaten, and the share of the men who went with me. Let Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre take their share.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things the word of the Lord came to Abram in a vision: “Fear not, Abram, I am your shield; your reward shall be very great.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abram said, “O Lord God, what will you give me, for I continue childless, and the heir of my house is Eliezer of Damascus?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abram said, “Behold, you have given me no offspring, and a member of my household will be my heir.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, the word of the Lord came to him: “This man shall not be your heir; your very own son shall be your heir.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he brought him outside and said, “Look toward heaven, and number the stars, if you are able to number them.” Then he said to him, “So shall your offspring be.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he believed the Lord, and he counted it to him as righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “I am the Lord who brought you out from Ur of the Chaldeans to give you this land to possess.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “O Lord God, how am I to know that I shall possess it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “Bring me a heifer three years old, a female goat three years old, a ram three years old, a turtledove, and a young pigeon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he brought him all these, cut them in half, and laid each half over against the other. But he did not cut the birds in half.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when birds of prey came down on the carcasses, Abram drove them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the sun was going down, a deep sleep fell on Abram. And behold, dreadful and great darkness fell upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Abram, “Know for certain that your offspring will be sojourners in a land that is not theirs and will be servants there, and they will be afflicted for four hundred years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will bring judgment on the nation that they serve, and afterward they shall come out with great possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for you, you shall go to your fathers in peace; you shall be buried in a good old age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall come back here in the fourth generation, for the iniquity of the Amorites is not yet complete.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sun had gone down and it was dark, behold, a smoking fire pot and a flaming torch passed between these pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day the Lord made a covenant with Abram, saying, “To your offspring I give this land, from the river of Egypt to the great river, the river Euphrates,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the land of the Kenites, the Kenizzites, the Kadmonites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Rephaim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Girgashites and the Jebusites.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Sarai, Abram's wife, had borne him no children. She had a female Egyptian servant whose name was Hagar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Sarai said to Abram, “Behold now, the Lord has prevented me from bearing children. Go in to my servant; it may be that I shall obtain children by her.” And Abram listened to the voice of Sarai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, after Abram had lived ten years in the land of Canaan, Sarai, Abram's wife, took Hagar the Egyptian, her servant, and gave her to Abram her husband as a wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went in to Hagar, and she conceived. And when she saw that she had conceived, she looked with contempt on her mistress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Sarai said to Abram, “May the wrong done to me be on you! I gave my servant to your embrace, and when she saw that she had conceived, she looked on me with contempt. May the Lord judge between you and me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abram said to Sarai, “Behold, your servant is in your power; do to her as you please.” Then Sarai dealt harshly with her, and she fled from her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel of the Lord found her by a spring of water in the wilderness, the spring on the way to Shur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Hagar, servant of Sarai, where have you come from and where are you going?” She said, “I am fleeing from my mistress Sarai.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel of the Lord said to her, “Return to your mistress and submit to her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel of the Lord also said to her, “I will surely multiply your offspring so that they cannot be numbered for multitude.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the angel of the Lord said to her,
“Behold, you are pregnant
    and shall bear a son.
You shall call his name Ishmael,
    because the Lord has listened to your affliction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall be a wild donkey of a man,
    his hand against everyone
    and everyone's hand against him,
and he shall dwell over against all his kinsmen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she called the name of the Lord who spoke to her, “You are a God of seeing,” for she said, “Truly here I have seen him who looks after me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the well was called Beer-lahai-roi; it lies between Kadesh and Bered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hagar bore Abram a son, and Abram called the name of his son, whom Hagar bore, Ishmael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abram was eighty-six years old when Hagar bore Ishmael to Abram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Abram was ninety-nine years old the Lord appeared to Abram and said to him, “I am God Almighty; walk before me, and be blameless,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that I may make my covenant between me and you, and may multiply you greatly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abram fell on his face. And God said to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, my covenant is with you, and you shall be the father of a multitude of nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No longer shall your name be called Abram, but your name shall be Abraham, for I have made you the father of a multitude of nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make you exceedingly fruitful, and I will make you into nations, and kings shall come from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will establish my covenant between me and you and your offspring after you throughout their generations for an everlasting covenant, to be God to you and to your offspring after you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will give to you and to your offspring after you the land of your sojournings, all the land of Canaan, for an everlasting possession, and I will be their God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said to Abraham, “As for you, you shall keep my covenant, you and your offspring after you throughout their generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is my covenant, which you shall keep, between me and you and your offspring after you: Every male among you shall be circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall be circumcised in the flesh of your foreskins, and it shall be a sign of the covenant between me and you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who is eight days old among you shall be circumcised. Every male throughout your generations, whether born in your house or bought with your money from any foreigner who is not of your offspring,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: both he who is born in your house and he who is bought with your money, shall surely be circumcised. So shall my covenant be in your flesh an everlasting covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any uncircumcised male who is not circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin shall be cut off from his people; he has broken my covenant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said to Abraham, “As for Sarai your wife, you shall not call her name Sarai, but Sarah shall be her name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bless her, and moreover, I will give you a son by her. I will bless her, and she shall become nations; kings of peoples shall come from her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham fell on his face and laughed and said to himself, “Shall a child be born to a man who is a hundred years old? Shall Sarah, who is ninety years old, bear a child?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham said to God, “Oh that Ishmael might live before you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God said, “No, but Sarah your wife shall bear you a son, and you shall call his name Isaac. I will establish my covenant with him as an everlasting covenant for his offspring after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for Ishmael, I have heard you; behold, I have blessed him and will make him fruitful and multiply him greatly. He shall father twelve princes, and I will make him into a great nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will establish my covenant with Isaac, whom Sarah shall bear to you at this time next year.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had finished talking with him, God went up from Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham took Ishmael his son and all those born in his house or bought with his money, every male among the men of Abraham's house, and he circumcised the flesh of their foreskins that very day, as God had said to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ishmael his son was thirteen years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That very day Abraham and his son Ishmael were circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the men of his house, those born in the house and those bought with money from a foreigner, were circumcised with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord appeared to him by the oaks of Mamre, as he sat at the door of his tent in the heat of the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He lifted up his eyes and looked, and behold, three men were standing in front of him. When he saw them, he ran from the tent door to meet them and bowed himself to the earth
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “O Lord, if I have found favor in your sight, do not pass by your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let a little water be brought, and wash your feet, and rest yourselves under the tree,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while I bring a morsel of bread, that you may refresh yourselves, and after that you may pass on—since you have come to your servant.” So they said, “Do as you have said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham went quickly into the tent to Sarah and said, “Quick! Three seahs of fine flour! Knead it, and make cakes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham ran to the herd and took a calf, tender and good, and gave it to a young man, who prepared it quickly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took curds and milk and the calf that he had prepared, and set it before them. And he stood by them under the tree while they ate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Where is Sarah your wife?” And he said, “She is in the tent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “I will surely return to you about this time next year, and Sarah your wife shall have a son.” And Sarah was listening at the tent door behind him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Abraham and Sarah were old, advanced in years. The way of women had ceased to be with Sarah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Sarah laughed to herself, saying, “After I am worn out, and my lord is old, shall I have pleasure?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Abraham, “Why did Sarah laugh and say, ‘Shall I indeed bear a child, now that I am old?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is anything too hard for the Lord? At the appointed time I will return to you, about this time next year, and Sarah shall have a son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Sarah denied it, saying, “I did not laugh,” for she was afraid. He said, “No, but you did laugh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men set out from there, and they looked down toward Sodom. And Abraham went with them to set them on their way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “Shall I hide from Abraham what I am about to do,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: seeing that Abraham shall surely become a great and mighty nation, and all the nations of the earth shall be blessed in him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have chosen him, that he may command his children and his household after him to keep the way of the Lord by doing righteousness and justice, so that the Lord may bring to Abraham what he has promised him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “Because the outcry against Sodom and Gomorrah is great and their sin is very grave,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will go down to see whether they have done altogether according to the outcry that has come to me. And if not, I will know.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the men turned from there and went toward Sodom, but Abraham still stood before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham drew near and said, “Will you indeed sweep away the righteous with the wicked?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suppose there are fifty righteous within the city. Will you then sweep away the place and not spare it for the fifty righteous who are in it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Far be it from you to do such a thing, to put the righteous to death with the wicked, so that the righteous fare as the wicked! Far be that from you! Shall not the Judge of all the earth do what is just?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, “If I find at Sodom fifty righteous in the city, I will spare the whole place for their sake.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham answered and said, “Behold, I have undertaken to speak to the Lord, I who am but dust and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suppose five of the fifty righteous are lacking. Will you destroy the whole city for lack of five?” And he said, “I will not destroy it if I find forty-five there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he spoke to him and said, “Suppose forty are found there.” He answered, “For the sake of forty I will not do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Oh let not the Lord be angry, and I will speak. Suppose thirty are found there.” He answered, “I will not do it, if I find thirty there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Behold, I have undertaken to speak to the Lord. Suppose twenty are found there.” He answered, “For the sake of twenty I will not destroy it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Oh let not the Lord be angry, and I will speak again but this once. Suppose ten are found there.” He answered, “For the sake of ten I will not destroy it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord went his way, when he had finished speaking to Abraham, and Abraham returned to his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two angels came to Sodom in the evening, and Lot was sitting in the gate of Sodom. When Lot saw them, he rose to meet them and bowed himself with his face to the earth
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “My lords, please turn aside to your servant's house and spend the night and wash your feet. Then you may rise up early and go on your way.” They said, “No; we will spend the night in the town square.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he pressed them strongly; so they turned aside to him and entered his house. And he made them a feast and baked unleavened bread, and they ate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But before they lay down, the men of the city, the men of Sodom, both young and old, all the people to the last man, surrounded the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they called to Lot, “Where are the men who came to you tonight? Bring them out to us, that we may know them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lot went out to the men at the entrance, shut the door after him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “I beg you, my brothers, do not act so wickedly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have two daughters who have not known any man. Let me bring them out to you, and do to them as you please. Only do nothing to these men, for they have come under the shelter of my roof.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said, “Stand back!” And they said, “This fellow came to sojourn, and he has become the judge! Now we will deal worse with you than with them.” Then they pressed hard against the man Lot, and drew near to break the door down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the men reached out their hands and brought Lot into the house with them and shut the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they struck with blindness the men who were at the entrance of the house, both small and great, so that they wore themselves out groping for the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men said to Lot, “Have you anyone else here? Sons-in-law, sons, daughters, or anyone you have in the city, bring them out of the place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are about to destroy this place, because the outcry against its people has become great before the Lord, and the Lord has sent us to destroy it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Lot went out and said to his sons-in-law, who were to marry his daughters, “Up! Get out of this place, for the Lord is about to destroy the city.” But he seemed to his sons-in-law to be jesting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As morning dawned, the angels urged Lot, saying, “Up! Take your wife and your two daughters who are here, lest you be swept away in the punishment of the city.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he lingered. So the men seized him and his wife and his two daughters by the hand, the Lord being merciful to him, and they brought him out and set him outside the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they brought them out, one said, “Escape for your life. Do not look back or stop anywhere in the valley. Escape to the hills, lest you be swept away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Lot said to them, “Oh, no, my lords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, your servant has found favor in your sight, and you have shown me great kindness in saving my life. But I cannot escape to the hills, lest the disaster overtake me and I die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, this city is near enough to flee to, and it is a little one. Let me escape there—is it not a little one?—and my life will be saved!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “Behold, I grant you this favor also, that I will not overthrow the city of which you have spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Escape there quickly, for I can do nothing till you arrive there.” Therefore the name of the city was called Zoar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sun had risen on the earth when Lot came to Zoar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord rained on Sodom and Gomorrah sulfur and fire from the Lord out of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he overthrew those cities, and all the valley, and all the inhabitants of the cities, and what grew on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Lot's wife, behind him, looked back, and she became a pillar of salt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham went early in the morning to the place where he had stood before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he looked down toward Sodom and Gomorrah and toward all the land of the valley, and he looked and, behold, the smoke of the land went up like the smoke of a furnace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it was that, when God destroyed the cities of the valley, God remembered Abraham and sent Lot out of the midst of the overthrow when he overthrew the cities in which Lot had lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Lot went up out of Zoar and lived in the hills with his two daughters, for he was afraid to live in Zoar. So he lived in a cave with his two daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the firstborn said to the younger, “Our father is old, and there is not a man on earth to come in to us after the manner of all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come, let us make our father drink wine, and we will lie with him, that we may preserve offspring from our father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they made their father drink wine that night. And the firstborn went in and lay with her father. He did not know when she lay down or when she arose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, the firstborn said to the younger, “Behold, I lay last night with my father. Let us make him drink wine tonight also. Then you go in and lie with him, that we may preserve offspring from our father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they made their father drink wine that night also. And the younger arose and lay with him, and he did not know when she lay down or when she arose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus both the daughters of Lot became pregnant by their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The firstborn bore a son and called his name Moab. He is the father of the Moabites to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The younger also bore a son and called his name Ben-ammi. He is the father of the Ammonites to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there Abraham journeyed toward the territory of the Negeb and lived between Kadesh and Shur; and he sojourned in Gerar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham said of Sarah his wife, “She is my sister.” And Abimelech king of Gerar sent and took Sarah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God came to Abimelech in a dream by night and said to him, “Behold, you are a dead man because of the woman whom you have taken, for she is a man's wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Abimelech had not approached her. So he said, “Lord, will you kill an innocent people?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did he not himself say to me, ‘She is my sister’? And she herself said, ‘He is my brother.’ In the integrity of my heart and the innocence of my hands I have done this.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God said to him in the dream, “Yes, I know that you have done this in the integrity of your heart, and it was I who kept you from sinning against me. Therefore I did not let you touch her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now then, return the man's wife, for he is a prophet, so that he will pray for you, and you shall live. But if you do not return her, know that you shall surely die, you and all who are yours.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abimelech rose early in the morning and called all his servants and told them all these things. And the men were very much afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abimelech called Abraham and said to him, “What have you done to us? And how have I sinned against you, that you have brought on me and my kingdom a great sin? You have done to me things that ought not to be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech said to Abraham, “What did you see, that you did this thing?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham said, “I did it because I thought, ‘There is no fear of God at all in this place, and they will kill me because of my wife.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Besides, she is indeed my sister, the daughter of my father though not the daughter of my mother, and she became my wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when God caused me to wander from my father's house, I said to her, ‘This is the kindness you must do me: at every place to which we come, say of me, “He is my brother.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abimelech took sheep and oxen, and male servants and female servants, and gave them to Abraham, and returned Sarah his wife to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech said, “Behold, my land is before you; dwell where it pleases you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Sarah he said, “Behold, I have given your brother a thousand pieces of silver. It is a sign of your innocence in the eyes of all who are with you, and before everyone you are vindicated.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham prayed to God, and God healed Abimelech, and also healed his wife and female slaves so that they bore children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord had closed all the wombs of the house of Abimelech because of Sarah, Abraham's wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord visited Sarah as he had said, and the Lord did to Sarah as he had promised.
verses.speaker: Narrator
