verses.text: And Sarah conceived and bore Abraham a son in his old age at the time of which God had spoken to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham called the name of his son who was born to him, whom Sarah bore him, Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham circumcised his son Isaac when he was eight days old, as God had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham was a hundred years old when his son Isaac was born to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Sarah said, “God has made laughter for me; everyone who hears will laugh over me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said, “Who would have said to Abraham that Sarah would nurse children? Yet I have borne him a son in his old age.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the child grew and was weaned. And Abraham made a great feast on the day that Isaac was weaned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian, whom she had borne to Abraham, laughing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she said to Abraham, “Cast out this slave woman with her son, for the son of this slave woman shall not be heir with my son Isaac.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the thing was very displeasing to Abraham on account of his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God said to Abraham, “Be not displeased because of the boy and because of your slave woman. Whatever Sarah says to you, do as she tells you, for through Isaac shall your offspring be named.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will make a nation of the son of the slave woman also, because he is your offspring.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abraham rose early in the morning and took bread and a skin of water and gave it to Hagar, putting it on her shoulder, along with the child, and sent her away. And she departed and wandered in the wilderness of Beersheba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the water in the skin was gone, she put the child under one of the bushes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she went and sat down opposite him a good way off, about the distance of a bowshot, for she said, “Let me not look on the death of the child.” And as she sat opposite him, she lifted up her voice and wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God heard the voice of the boy, and the angel of God called to Hagar from heaven and said to her, “What troubles you, Hagar? Fear not, for God has heard the voice of the boy where he is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Up! Lift up the boy, and hold him fast with your hand, for I will make him into a great nation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water. And she went and filled the skin with water and gave the boy a drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God was with the boy, and he grew up. He lived in the wilderness and became an expert with the bow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He lived in the wilderness of Paran, and his mother took a wife for him from the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Abimelech and Phicol the commander of his army said to Abraham, “God is with you in all that you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore swear to me here by God that you will not deal falsely with me or with my descendants or with my posterity, but as I have dealt kindly with you, so you will deal with me and with the land where you have sojourned.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham said, “I will swear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Abraham reproved Abimelech about a well of water that Abimelech's servants had seized,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abimelech said, “I do not know who has done this thing; you did not tell me, and I have not heard of it until today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abraham took sheep and oxen and gave them to Abimelech, and the two men made a covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham set seven ewe lambs of the flock apart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech said to Abraham, “What is the meaning of these seven ewe lambs that you have set apart?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “These seven ewe lambs you will take from my hand, that this may be a witness for me that I dug this well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore that place was called Beersheba, because there both of them swore an oath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they made a covenant at Beersheba. Then Abimelech and Phicol the commander of his army rose up and returned to the land of the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham planted a tamarisk tree in Beersheba and called there on the name of the Lord, the Everlasting God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham sojourned many days in the land of the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things God tested Abraham and said to him, “Abraham!” And he said, “Here I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Take your son, your only son Isaac, whom you love, and go to the land of Moriah, and offer him there as a burnt offering on one of the mountains of which I shall tell you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abraham rose early in the morning, saddled his donkey, and took two of his young men with him, and his son Isaac. And he cut the wood for the burnt offering and arose and went to the place of which God had told him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the third day Abraham lifted up his eyes and saw the place from afar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham said to his young men, “Stay here with the donkey; I and the boy will go over there and worship and come again to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering and laid it on Isaac his son. And he took in his hand the fire and the knife. So they went both of them together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaac said to his father Abraham, “My father!” And he said, “Here I am, my son.” He said, “Behold, the fire and the wood, but where is the lamb for a burnt offering?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham said, “God will provide for himself the lamb for a burnt offering, my son.” So they went both of them together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the place of which God had told him, Abraham built the altar there and laid the wood in order and bound Isaac his son and laid him on the altar, on top of the wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham reached out his hand and took the knife to slaughter his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the angel of the Lord called to him from heaven and said, “Abraham, Abraham!” And he said, “Here I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Do not lay your hand on the boy or do anything to him, for now I know that you fear God, seeing you have not withheld your son, your only son, from me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham lifted up his eyes and looked, and behold, behind him was a ram, caught in a thicket by his horns. And Abraham went and took the ram and offered it up as a burnt offering instead of his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abraham called the name of that place, “The Lord will provide”; as it is said to this day, “On the mount of the Lord it shall be provided.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of the Lord called to Abraham a second time from heaven
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “By myself I have sworn, declares the Lord, because you have done this and have not withheld your son, your only son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will surely bless you, and I will surely multiply your offspring as the stars of heaven and as the sand that is on the seashore. And your offspring shall possess the gate of his enemies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in your offspring shall all the nations of the earth be blessed, because you have obeyed my voice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abraham returned to his young men, and they arose and went together to Beersheba. And Abraham lived at Beersheba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after these things it was told to Abraham, “Behold, Milcah also has borne children to your brother Nahor:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Uz his firstborn, Buz his brother, Kemuel the father of Aram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, and Bethuel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Bethuel fathered Rebekah.) These eight Milcah bore to Nahor, Abraham's brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, his concubine, whose name was Reumah, bore Tebah, Gaham, Tahash, and Maacah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sarah lived 127 years; these were the years of the life of Sarah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Sarah died at Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron) in the land of Canaan, and Abraham went in to mourn for Sarah and to weep for her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham rose up from before his dead and said to the Hittites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am a sojourner and foreigner among you; give me property among you for a burying place, that I may bury my dead out of my sight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Hittites answered Abraham,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear us, my lord; you are a prince of God among us. Bury your dead in the choicest of our tombs. None of us will withhold from you his tomb to hinder you from burying your dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham rose and bowed to the Hittites, the people of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “If you are willing that I should bury my dead out of my sight, hear me and entreat for me Ephron the son of Zohar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that he may give me the cave of Machpelah, which he owns; it is at the end of his field. For the full price let him give it to me in your presence as property for a burying place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Ephron was sitting among the Hittites, and Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the hearing of the Hittites, of all who went in at the gate of his city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No, my lord, hear me: I give you the field, and I give you the cave that is in it. In the sight of the sons of my people I give it to you. Bury your dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham bowed down before the people of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to Ephron in the hearing of the people of the land, “But if you will, hear me: I give the price of the field. Accept it from me, that I may bury my dead there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ephron answered Abraham,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My lord, listen to me: a piece of land worth four hundred shekels of silver, what is that between you and me? Bury your dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham listened to Ephron, and Abraham weighed out for Ephron the silver that he had named in the hearing of the Hittites, four hundred shekels of silver, according to the weights current among the merchants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the field of Ephron in Machpelah, which was to the east of Mamre, the field with the cave that was in it and all the trees that were in the field, throughout its whole area, was made over
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to Abraham as a possession in the presence of the Hittites, before all who went in at the gate of his city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field of Machpelah east of Mamre (that is, Hebron) in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The field and the cave that is in it were made over to Abraham as property for a burying place by the Hittites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Abraham was old, well advanced in years. And the Lord had blessed Abraham in all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham said to his servant, the oldest of his household, who had charge of all that he had, “Put your hand under my thigh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that I may make you swear by the Lord, the God of heaven and God of the earth, that you will not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I dwell,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but will go to my country and to my kindred, and take a wife for my son Isaac.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant said to him, “Perhaps the woman may not be willing to follow me to this land. Must I then take your son back to the land from which you came?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham said to him, “See to it that you do not take my son back there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord, the God of heaven, who took me from my father's house and from the land of my kindred, and who spoke to me and swore to me, ‘To your offspring I will give this land,’ he will send his angel before you, and you shall take a wife for my son from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the woman is not willing to follow you, then you will be free from this oath of mine; only you must not take my son back there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the servant put his hand under the thigh of Abraham his master and swore to him concerning this matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the servant took ten of his master's camels and departed, taking all sorts of choice gifts from his master; and he arose and went to Mesopotamia to the city of Nahor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the camels kneel down outside the city by the well of water at the time of evening, the time when women go out to draw water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “O Lord, God of my master Abraham, please grant me success today and show steadfast love to my master Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am standing by the spring of water, and the daughters of the men of the city are coming out to draw water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the young woman to whom I shall say, ‘Please let down your jar that I may drink,’ and who shall say, ‘Drink, and I will water your camels’—let her be the one whom you have appointed for your servant Isaac. By this I shall know that you have shown steadfast love to my master.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before he had finished speaking, behold, Rebekah, who was born to Bethuel the son of Milcah, the wife of Nahor, Abraham's brother, came out with her water jar on her shoulder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young woman was very attractive in appearance, a maiden whom no man had known. She went down to the spring and filled her jar and came up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the servant ran to meet her and said, “Please give me a little water to drink from your jar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said, “Drink, my lord.” And she quickly let down her jar upon her hand and gave him a drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she had finished giving him a drink, she said, “I will draw water for your camels also, until they have finished drinking.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she quickly emptied her jar into the trough and ran again to the well to draw water, and she drew for all his camels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man gazed at her in silence to learn whether the Lord had prospered his journey or not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the camels had finished drinking, the man took a gold ring weighing a half shekel, and two bracelets for her arms weighing ten gold shekels,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Please tell me whose daughter you are. Is there room in your father's house for us to spend the night?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to him, “I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah, whom she bore to Nahor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She added, “We have plenty of both straw and fodder, and room to spend the night.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man bowed his head and worshiped the Lord
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Blessed be the Lord, the God of my master Abraham, who has not forsaken his steadfast love and his faithfulness toward my master. As for me, the Lord has led me in the way to the house of my master's kinsmen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the young woman ran and told her mother's household about these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rebekah had a brother whose name was Laban. Laban ran out toward the man, to the spring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as he saw the ring and the bracelets on his sister's arms, and heard the words of Rebekah his sister, “Thus the man spoke to me,” he went to the man. And behold, he was standing by the camels at the spring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Come in, O blessed of the Lord. Why do you stand outside? For I have prepared the house and a place for the camels.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the man came to the house and unharnessed the camels, and gave straw and fodder to the camels, and there was water to wash his feet and the feet of the men who were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then food was set before him to eat. But he said, “I will not eat until I have said what I have to say.” He said, “Speak on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “I am Abraham's servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord has greatly blessed my master, and he has become great. He has given him flocks and herds, silver and gold, male servants and female servants, camels and donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Sarah my master's wife bore a son to my master when she was old, and to him he has given all that he has.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My master made me swear, saying, ‘You shall not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I dwell,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you shall go to my father's house and to my clan and take a wife for my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I said to my master, ‘Perhaps the woman will not follow me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to me, ‘The Lord, before whom I have walked, will send his angel with you and prosper your way. You shall take a wife for my son from my clan and from my father's house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will be free from my oath, when you come to my clan. And if they will not give her to you, you will be free from my oath.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I came today to the spring and said, ‘O Lord, the God of my master Abraham, if now you are prospering the way that I go,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: behold, I am standing by the spring of water. Let the virgin who comes out to draw water, to whom I shall say, “Please give me a little water from your jar to drink,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and who will say to me, “Drink, and I will draw for your camels also,” let her be the woman whom the Lord has appointed for my master's son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Before I had finished speaking in my heart, behold, Rebekah came out with her water jar on her shoulder, and she went down to the spring and drew water. I said to her, ‘Please let me drink.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She quickly let down her jar from her shoulder and said, ‘Drink, and I will give your camels drink also.’ So I drank, and she gave the camels drink also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I asked her, ‘Whose daughter are you?’ She said, ‘The daughter of Bethuel, Nahor's son, whom Milcah bore to him.’ So I put the ring on her nose and the bracelets on her arms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I bowed my head and worshiped the Lord and blessed the Lord, the God of my master Abraham, who had led me by the right way to take the daughter of my master's kinsman for his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now then, if you are going to show steadfast love and faithfulness to my master, tell me; and if not, tell me, that I may turn to the right hand or to the left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Laban and Bethuel answered and said, “The thing has come from the Lord; we cannot speak to you bad or good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, Rebekah is before you; take her and go, and let her be the wife of your master's son, as the Lord has spoken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Abraham's servant heard their words, he bowed himself to the earth before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the servant brought out jewelry of silver and of gold, and garments, and gave them to Rebekah. He also gave to her brother and to her mother costly ornaments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he and the men who were with him ate and drank, and they spent the night there. When they arose in the morning, he said, “Send me away to my master.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her brother and her mother said, “Let the young woman remain with us a while, at least ten days; after that she may go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “Do not delay me, since the Lord has prospered my way. Send me away that I may go to my master.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Let us call the young woman and ask her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they called Rebekah and said to her, “Will you go with this man?” She said, “I will go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they sent away Rebekah their sister and her nurse, and Abraham's servant and his men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they blessed Rebekah and said to her,
“Our sister, may you become
    thousands of ten thousands,
and may your offspring possess
    the gate of those who hate him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Rebekah and her young women arose and rode on the camels and followed the man. Thus the servant took Rebekah and went his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Isaac had returned from Beer-lahai-roi and was dwelling in the Negeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaac went out to meditate in the field toward evening. And he lifted up his eyes and saw, and behold, there were camels coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Rebekah lifted up her eyes, and when she saw Isaac, she dismounted from the camel
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to the servant, “Who is that man, walking in the field to meet us?” The servant said, “It is my master.” So she took her veil and covered herself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the servant told Isaac all the things that he had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Isaac brought her into the tent of Sarah his mother and took Rebekah, and she became his wife, and he loved her. So Isaac was comforted after his mother's death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham took another wife, whose name was Keturah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She bore him Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jokshan fathered Sheba and Dedan. The sons of Dedan were Asshurim, Letushim, and Leummim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the children of Keturah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham gave all he had to Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to the sons of his concubines Abraham gave gifts, and while he was still living he sent them away from his son Isaac, eastward to the east country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the days of the years of Abraham's life, 175 years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham breathed his last and died in a good old age, an old man and full of years, and was gathered to his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaac and Ishmael his sons buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron the son of Zohar the Hittite, east of Mamre,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the field that Abraham purchased from the Hittites. There Abraham was buried, with Sarah his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the death of Abraham, God blessed Isaac his son. And Isaac settled at Beer-lahai-roi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the generations of Ishmael, Abraham's son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah's servant, bore to Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the sons of Ishmael, named in the order of their birth: Nebaioth, the firstborn of Ishmael; and Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mishma, Dumah, Massa,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Ishmael and these are their names, by their villages and by their encampments, twelve princes according to their tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (These are the years of the life of Ishmael: 137 years. He breathed his last and died, and was gathered to his people.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They settled from Havilah to Shur, which is opposite Egypt in the direction of Assyria. He settled over against all his kinsmen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the generations of Isaac, Abraham's son: Abraham fathered Isaac,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah, the daughter of Bethuel the Aramean of Paddan-aram, the sister of Laban the Aramean, to be his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaac prayed to the Lord for his wife, because she was barren. And the Lord granted his prayer, and Rebekah his wife conceived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children struggled together within her, and she said, “If it is thus, why is this happening to me?” So she went to inquire of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the Lord said to her,
“Two nations are in your womb,
    and two peoples from within you shall be divided;
the one shall be stronger than the other,
    the older shall serve the younger.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When her days to give birth were completed, behold, there were twins in her womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first came out red, all his body like a hairy cloak, so they called his name Esau.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward his brother came out with his hand holding Esau's heel, so his name was called Jacob. Isaac was sixty years old when she bore them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the boys grew up, Esau was a skillful hunter, a man of the field, while Jacob was a quiet man, dwelling in tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaac loved Esau because he ate of his game, but Rebekah loved Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once when Jacob was cooking stew, Esau came in from the field, and he was exhausted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Esau said to Jacob, “Let me eat some of that red stew, for I am exhausted!” (Therefore his name was called Edom.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob said, “Sell me your birthright now.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Esau said, “I am about to die; of what use is a birthright to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob said, “Swear to me now.” So he swore to him and sold his birthright to Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob gave Esau bread and lentil stew, and he ate and drank and rose and went his way. Thus Esau despised his birthright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a famine in the land, besides the former famine that was in the days of Abraham. And Isaac went to Gerar to Abimelech king of the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord appeared to him and said, “Do not go down to Egypt; dwell in the land of which I shall tell you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sojourn in this land, and I will be with you and will bless you, for to you and to your offspring I will give all these lands, and I will establish the oath that I swore to Abraham your father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will multiply your offspring as the stars of heaven and will give to your offspring all these lands. And in your offspring all the nations of the earth shall be blessed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because Abraham obeyed my voice and kept my charge, my commandments, my statutes, and my laws.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Isaac settled in Gerar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the men of the place asked him about his wife, he said, “She is my sister,” for he feared to say, “My wife,” thinking, “lest the men of the place should kill me because of Rebekah,” because she was attractive in appearance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had been there a long time, Abimelech king of the Philistines looked out of a window and saw Isaac laughing with Rebekah his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abimelech called Isaac and said, “Behold, she is your wife. How then could you say, ‘She is my sister’?” Isaac said to him, “Because I thought, ‘Lest I die because of her.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abimelech said, “What is this you have done to us? One of the people might easily have lain with your wife, and you would have brought guilt upon us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abimelech warned all the people, saying, “Whoever touches this man or his wife shall surely be put to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaac sowed in that land and reaped in the same year a hundredfold. The Lord blessed him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the man became rich, and gained more and more until he became very wealthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had possessions of flocks and herds and many servants, so that the Philistines envied him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now the Philistines had stopped and filled with earth all the wells that his father's servants had dug in the days of Abraham his father.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech said to Isaac, “Go away from us, for you are much mightier than we.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Isaac departed from there and encamped in the Valley of Gerar and settled there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaac dug again the wells of water that had been dug in the days of Abraham his father, which the Philistines had stopped after the death of Abraham. And he gave them the names that his father had given them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Isaac's servants dug in the valley and found there a well of spring water,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the herdsmen of Gerar quarreled with Isaac's herdsmen, saying, “The water is ours.” So he called the name of the well Esek, because they contended with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they dug another well, and they quarreled over that also, so he called its name Sitnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he moved from there and dug another well, and they did not quarrel over it. So he called its name Rehoboth, saying, “For now the Lord has made room for us, and we shall be fruitful in the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there he went up to Beersheba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord appeared to him the same night and said, “I am the God of Abraham your father. Fear not, for I am with you and will bless you and multiply your offspring for my servant Abraham's sake.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he built an altar there and called upon the name of the Lord and pitched his tent there. And there Isaac's servants dug a well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Abimelech went to him from Gerar with Ahuzzath his adviser and Phicol the commander of his army,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaac said to them, “Why have you come to me, seeing that you hate me and have sent me away from you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “We see plainly that the Lord has been with you. So we said, let there be a sworn pact between us, between you and us, and let us make a covenant with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you will do us no harm, just as we have not touched you and have done to you nothing but good and have sent you away in peace. You are now the blessed of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he made them a feast, and they ate and drank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning they rose early and exchanged oaths. And Isaac sent them on their way, and they departed from him in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That same day Isaac's servants came and told him about the well that they had dug and said to him, “We have found water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called it Shibah; therefore the name of the city is Beersheba to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Esau was forty years old, he took Judith the daughter of Beeri the Hittite to be his wife, and Basemath the daughter of Elon the Hittite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they made life bitter for Isaac and Rebekah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Isaac was old and his eyes were dim so that he could not see, he called Esau his older son and said to him, “My son”; and he answered, “Here I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Behold, I am old; I do not know the day of my death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now then, take your weapons, your quiver and your bow, and go out to the field and hunt game for me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and prepare for me delicious food, such as I love, and bring it to me so that I may eat, that my soul may bless you before I die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Rebekah was listening when Isaac spoke to his son Esau. So when Esau went to the field to hunt for game and bring it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rebekah said to her son Jacob, “I heard your father speak to your brother Esau,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Bring me game and prepare for me delicious food, that I may eat it and bless you before the Lord before I die.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice as I command you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go to the flock and bring me two good young goats, so that I may prepare from them delicious food for your father, such as he loves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall bring it to your father to eat, so that he may bless you before he dies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jacob said to Rebekah his mother, “Behold, my brother Esau is a hairy man, and I am a smooth man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Perhaps my father will feel me, and I shall seem to be mocking him and bring a curse upon myself and not a blessing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His mother said to him, “Let your curse be on me, my son; only obey my voice, and go, bring them to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went and took them and brought them to his mother, and his mother prepared delicious food, such as his father loved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Rebekah took the best garments of Esau her older son, which were with her in the house, and put them on Jacob her younger son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the skins of the young goats she put on his hands and on the smooth part of his neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she put the delicious food and the bread, which she had prepared, into the hand of her son Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went in to his father and said, “My father.” And he said, “Here I am. Who are you, my son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob said to his father, “I am Esau your firstborn. I have done as you told me; now sit up and eat of my game, that your soul may bless me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Isaac said to his son, “How is it that you have found it so quickly, my son?” He answered, “Because the Lord your God granted me success.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Isaac said to Jacob, “Please come near, that I may feel you, my son, to know whether you are really my son Esau or not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob went near to Isaac his father, who felt him and said, “The voice is Jacob's voice, but the hands are the hands of Esau.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he did not recognize him, because his hands were hairy like his brother Esau's hands. So he blessed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Are you really my son Esau?” He answered, “I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Bring it near to me, that I may eat of my son's game and bless you.” So he brought it near to him, and he ate; and he brought him wine, and he drank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his father Isaac said to him, “Come near and kiss me, my son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he came near and kissed him. And Isaac smelled the smell of his garments and blessed him and said,
“See, the smell of my son
    is as the smell of a field that the Lord has blessed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May God give you of the dew of heaven
    and of the fatness of the earth
    and plenty of grain and wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let peoples serve you,
    and nations bow down to you.
Be lord over your brothers,
    and may your mother's sons bow down to you.
Cursed be everyone who curses you,
    and blessed be everyone who blesses you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as Isaac had finished blessing Jacob, when Jacob had scarcely gone out from the presence of Isaac his father, Esau his brother came in from his hunting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also prepared delicious food and brought it to his father. And he said to his father, “Let my father arise and eat of his son's game, that you may bless me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His father Isaac said to him, “Who are you?” He answered, “I am your son, your firstborn, Esau.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Isaac trembled very violently and said, “Who was it then that hunted game and brought it to me, and I ate it all before you came, and I have blessed him? Yes, and he shall be blessed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as Esau heard the words of his father, he cried out with an exceedingly great and bitter cry and said to his father, “Bless me, even me also, O my father!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “Your brother came deceitfully, and he has taken away your blessing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Esau said, “Is he not rightly named Jacob? For he has cheated me these two times. He took away my birthright, and behold, now he has taken away my blessing.” Then he said, “Have you not reserved a blessing for me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaac answered and said to Esau, “Behold, I have made him lord over you, and all his brothers I have given to him for servants, and with grain and wine I have sustained him. What then can I do for you, my son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Esau said to his father, “Have you but one blessing, my father? Bless me, even me also, O my father.” And Esau lifted up his voice and wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Isaac his father answered and said to him:
“Behold, away from the fatness of the earth shall your dwelling be,
    and away from the dew of heaven on high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By your sword you shall live,
    and you shall serve your brother;
but when you grow restless
    you shall break his yoke from your neck.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Esau hated Jacob because of the blessing with which his father had blessed him, and Esau said to himself, “The days of mourning for my father are approaching; then I will kill my brother Jacob.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the words of Esau her older son were told to Rebekah. So she sent and called Jacob her younger son and said to him, “Behold, your brother Esau comforts himself about you by planning to kill you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice. Arise, flee to Laban my brother in Haran
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and stay with him a while, until your brother's fury turns away—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until your brother's anger turns away from you, and he forgets what you have done to him. Then I will send and bring you from there. Why should I be bereft of you both in one day?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Rebekah said to Isaac, “I loathe my life because of the Hittite women. If Jacob marries one of the Hittite women like these, one of the women of the land, what good will my life be to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Isaac called Jacob and blessed him and directed him, “You must not take a wife from the Canaanite women.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arise, go to Paddan-aram to the house of Bethuel your mother's father, and take as your wife from there one of the daughters of Laban your mother's brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God Almighty bless you and make you fruitful and multiply you, that you may become a company of peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May he give the blessing of Abraham to you and to your offspring with you, that you may take possession of the land of your sojournings that God gave to Abraham!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Isaac sent Jacob away. And he went to Paddan-aram, to Laban, the son of Bethuel the Aramean, the brother of Rebekah, Jacob's and Esau's mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him away to Paddan-aram to take a wife from there, and that as he blessed him he directed him, “You must not take a wife from the Canaanite women,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that Jacob had obeyed his father and his mother and gone to Paddan-aram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Esau saw that the Canaanite women did not please Isaac his father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Esau went to Ishmael and took as his wife, besides the wives he had, Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael, Abraham's son, the sister of Nebaioth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob left Beersheba and went toward Haran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came to a certain place and stayed there that night, because the sun had set. Taking one of the stones of the place, he put it under his head and lay down in that place to sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he dreamed, and behold, there was a ladder set up on the earth, and the top of it reached to heaven. And behold, the angels of God were ascending and descending on it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, the Lord stood above it and said, “I am the Lord, the God of Abraham your father and the God of Isaac. The land on which you lie I will give to you and to your offspring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your offspring shall be like the dust of the earth, and you shall spread abroad to the west and to the east and to the north and to the south, and in you and your offspring shall all the families of the earth be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am with you and will keep you wherever you go, and will bring you back to this land. For I will not leave you until I have done what I have promised you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob awoke from his sleep and said, “Surely the Lord is in this place, and I did not know it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was afraid and said, “How awesome is this place! This is none other than the house of God, and this is the gate of heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So early in the morning Jacob took the stone that he had put under his head and set it up for a pillar and poured oil on the top of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called the name of that place Bethel, but the name of the city was Luz at the first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob made a vow, saying, “If God will be with me and will keep me in this way that I go, and will give me bread to eat and clothing to wear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that I come again to my father's house in peace, then the Lord shall be my God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and this stone, which I have set up for a pillar, shall be God's house. And of all that you give me I will give a full tenth to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob went on his journey and came to the land of the people of the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he looked, he saw a well in the field, and behold, three flocks of sheep lying beside it, for out of that well the flocks were watered. The stone on the well's mouth was large,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when all the flocks were gathered there, the shepherds would roll the stone from the mouth of the well and water the sheep, and put the stone back in its place over the mouth of the well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob said to them, “My brothers, where do you come from?” They said, “We are from Haran.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Do you know Laban the son of Nahor?” They said, “We know him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Is it well with him?” They said, “It is well; and see, Rachel his daughter is coming with the sheep!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Behold, it is still high day; it is not time for the livestock to be gathered together. Water the sheep and go, pasture them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said, “We cannot until all the flocks are gathered together and the stone is rolled from the mouth of the well; then we water the sheep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking with them, Rachel came with her father's sheep, for she was a shepherdess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as soon as Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban his mother's brother, and the sheep of Laban his mother's brother, Jacob came near and rolled the stone from the well's mouth and watered the flock of Laban his mother's brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob kissed Rachel and wept aloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob told Rachel that he was her father's kinsman, and that he was Rebekah's son, and she ran and told her father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as Laban heard the news about Jacob, his sister's son, he ran to meet him and embraced him and kissed him and brought him to his house. Jacob told Laban all these things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Laban said to him, “Surely you are my bone and my flesh!” And he stayed with him a month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Laban said to Jacob, “Because you are my kinsman, should you therefore serve me for nothing? Tell me, what shall your wages be?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Laban had two daughters. The name of the older was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leah's eyes were weak, but Rachel was beautiful in form and appearance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob loved Rachel. And he said, “I will serve you seven years for your younger daughter Rachel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Laban said, “It is better that I give her to you than that I should give her to any other man; stay with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob served seven years for Rachel, and they seemed to him but a few days because of the love he had for her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob said to Laban, “Give me my wife that I may go in to her, for my time is completed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Laban gathered together all the people of the place and made a feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in the evening he took his daughter Leah and brought her to Jacob, and he went in to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Laban gave his female servant Zilpah to his daughter Leah to be her servant.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the morning, behold, it was Leah! And Jacob said to Laban, “What is this you have done to me? Did I not serve with you for Rachel? Why then have you deceived me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Laban said, “It is not so done in our country, to give the younger before the firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Complete the week of this one, and we will give you the other also in return for serving me another seven years.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob did so, and completed her week. Then Laban gave him his daughter Rachel to be his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Laban gave his female servant Bilhah to his daughter Rachel to be her servant.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob went in to Rachel also, and he loved Rachel more than Leah, and served Laban for another seven years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord saw that Leah was hated, he opened her womb, but Rachel was barren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Leah conceived and bore a son, and she called his name Reuben, for she said, “Because the Lord has looked upon my affliction; for now my husband will love me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She conceived again and bore a son, and said, “Because the Lord has heard that I am hated, he has given me this son also.” And she called his name Simeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again she conceived and bore a son, and said, “Now this time my husband will be attached to me, because I have borne him three sons.” Therefore his name was called Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she conceived again and bore a son, and said, “This time I will praise the Lord.” Therefore she called his name Judah. Then she ceased bearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Rachel saw that she bore Jacob no children, she envied her sister. She said to Jacob, “Give me children, or I shall die!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob's anger was kindled against Rachel, and he said, “Am I in the place of God, who has withheld from you the fruit of the womb?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she said, “Here is my servant Bilhah; go in to her, so that she may give birth on my behalf, that even I may have children through her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she gave him her servant Bilhah as a wife, and Jacob went in to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Bilhah conceived and bore Jacob a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Rachel said, “God has judged me, and has also heard my voice and given me a son.” Therefore she called his name Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rachel's servant Bilhah conceived again and bore Jacob a second son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Rachel said, “With mighty wrestlings I have wrestled with my sister and have prevailed.” So she called his name Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Leah saw that she had ceased bearing children, she took her servant Zilpah and gave her to Jacob as a wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Leah's servant Zilpah bore Jacob a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Leah said, “Good fortune has come!” so she called his name Gad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leah's servant Zilpah bore Jacob a second son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Leah said, “Happy am I! For women have called me happy.” So she called his name Asher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the days of wheat harvest Reuben went and found mandrakes in the field and brought them to his mother Leah. Then Rachel said to Leah, “Please give me some of your son's mandrakes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she said to her, “Is it a small matter that you have taken away my husband? Would you take away my son's mandrakes also?” Rachel said, “Then he may lie with you tonight in exchange for your son's mandrakes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jacob came from the field in the evening, Leah went out to meet him and said, “You must come in to me, for I have hired you with my son's mandrakes.” So he lay with her that night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God listened to Leah, and she conceived and bore Jacob a fifth son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leah said, “God has given me my wages because I gave my servant to my husband.” So she called his name Issachar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Leah conceived again, and she bore Jacob a sixth son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Leah said, “God has endowed me with a good endowment; now my husband will honor me, because I have borne him six sons.” So she called his name Zebulun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward she bore a daughter and called her name Dinah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God remembered Rachel, and God listened to her and opened her womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She conceived and bore a son and said, “God has taken away my reproach.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she called his name Joseph, saying, “May the Lord add to me another son!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as Rachel had borne Joseph, Jacob said to Laban, “Send me away, that I may go to my own home and country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give me my wives and my children for whom I have served you, that I may go, for you know the service that I have given you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Laban said to him, “If I have found favor in your sight, I have learned by divination that the Lord has blessed me because of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Name your wages, and I will give it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob said to him, “You yourself know how I have served you, and how your livestock has fared with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you had little before I came, and it has increased abundantly, and the Lord has blessed you wherever I turned. But now when shall I provide for my own household also?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “What shall I give you?” Jacob said, “You shall not give me anything. If you will do this for me, I will again pasture your flock and keep it:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let me pass through all your flock today, removing from it every speckled and spotted sheep and every black lamb, and the spotted and speckled among the goats, and they shall be my wages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So my honesty will answer for me later, when you come to look into my wages with you. Every one that is not speckled and spotted among the goats and black among the lambs, if found with me, shall be counted stolen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Laban said, “Good! Let it be as you have said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that day Laban removed the male goats that were striped and spotted, and all the female goats that were speckled and spotted, every one that had white on it, and every lamb that was black, and put them in the charge of his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he set a distance of three days' journey between himself and Jacob, and Jacob pastured the rest of Laban's flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob took fresh sticks of poplar and almond and plane trees, and peeled white streaks in them, exposing the white of the sticks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He set the sticks that he had peeled in front of the flocks in the troughs, that is, the watering places, where the flocks came to drink. And since they bred when they came to drink,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the flocks bred in front of the sticks and so the flocks brought forth striped, speckled, and spotted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob separated the lambs and set the faces of the flocks toward the striped and all the black in the flock of Laban. He put his own droves apart and did not put them with Laban's flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever the stronger of the flock were breeding, Jacob would lay the sticks in the troughs before the eyes of the flock, that they might breed among the sticks,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but for the feebler of the flock he would not lay them there. So the feebler would be Laban's, and the stronger Jacob's.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the man increased greatly and had large flocks, female servants and male servants, and camels and donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jacob heard that the sons of Laban were saying, “Jacob has taken all that was our father's, and from what was our father's he has gained all this wealth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob saw that Laban did not regard him with favor as before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Jacob, “Return to the land of your fathers and to your kindred, and I will be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah into the field where his flock was
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “I see that your father does not regard me with favor as he did before. But the God of my father has been with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know that I have served your father with all my strength,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet your father has cheated me and changed my wages ten times. But God did not permit him to harm me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he said, ‘The spotted shall be your wages,’ then all the flock bore spotted; and if he said, ‘The striped shall be your wages,’ then all the flock bore striped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus God has taken away the livestock of your father and given them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the breeding season of the flock I lifted up my eyes and saw in a dream that the goats that mated with the flock were striped, spotted, and mottled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of God said to me in the dream, ‘Jacob,’ and I said, ‘Here I am!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, ‘Lift up your eyes and see, all the goats that mate with the flock are striped, spotted, and mottled, for I have seen all that Laban is doing to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the God of Bethel, where you anointed a pillar and made a vow to me. Now arise, go out from this land and return to the land of your kindred.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Rachel and Leah answered and said to him, “Is there any portion or inheritance left to us in our father's house?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are we not regarded by him as foreigners? For he has sold us, and he has indeed devoured our money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the wealth that God has taken away from our father belongs to us and to our children. Now then, whatever God has said to you, do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob arose and set his sons and his wives on camels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He drove away all his livestock, all his property that he had gained, the livestock in his possession that he had acquired in Paddan-aram, to go to the land of Canaan to his father Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Laban had gone to shear his sheep, and Rachel stole her father's household gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob tricked Laban the Aramean, by not telling him that he intended to flee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He fled with all that he had and arose and crossed the Euphrates, and set his face toward the hill country of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was told Laban on the third day that Jacob had fled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he took his kinsmen with him and pursued him for seven days and followed close after him into the hill country of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God came to Laban the Aramean in a dream by night and said to him, “Be careful not to say anything to Jacob, either good or bad.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Laban overtook Jacob. Now Jacob had pitched his tent in the hill country, and Laban with his kinsmen pitched tents in the hill country of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Laban said to Jacob, “What have you done, that you have tricked me and driven away my daughters like captives of the sword?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why did you flee secretly and trick me, and did not tell me, so that I might have sent you away with mirth and songs, with tambourine and lyre?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why did you not permit me to kiss my sons and my daughters farewell? Now you have done foolishly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is in my power to do you harm. But the God of your father spoke to me last night, saying, ‘Be careful not to say anything to Jacob, either good or bad.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now you have gone away because you longed greatly for your father's house, but why did you steal my gods?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob answered and said to Laban, “Because I was afraid, for I thought that you would take your daughters from me by force.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone with whom you find your gods shall not live. In the presence of our kinsmen point out what I have that is yours, and take it.” Now Jacob did not know that Rachel had stolen them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Laban went into Jacob's tent and into Leah's tent and into the tent of the two female servants, but he did not find them. And he went out of Leah's tent and entered Rachel's.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Rachel had taken the household gods and put them in the camel's saddle and sat on them. Laban felt all about the tent, but did not find them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said to her father, “Let not my lord be angry that I cannot rise before you, for the way of women is upon me.” So he searched but did not find the household gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob became angry and berated Laban. Jacob said to Laban, “What is my offense? What is my sin, that you have hotly pursued me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have felt through all my goods; what have you found of all your household goods? Set it here before my kinsmen and your kinsmen, that they may decide between us two.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These twenty years I have been with you. Your ewes and your female goats have not miscarried, and I have not eaten the rams of your flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What was torn by wild beasts I did not bring to you. I bore the loss of it myself. From my hand you required it, whether stolen by day or stolen by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There I was: by day the heat consumed me, and the cold by night, and my sleep fled from my eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These twenty years I have been in your house. I served you fourteen years for your two daughters, and six years for your flock, and you have changed my wages ten times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the God of my father, the God of Abraham and the Fear of Isaac, had not been on my side, surely now you would have sent me away empty-handed. God saw my affliction and the labor of my hands and rebuked you last night.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Laban answered and said to Jacob, “The daughters are my daughters, the children are my children, the flocks are my flocks, and all that you see is mine. But what can I do this day for these my daughters or for their children whom they have borne?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come now, let us make a covenant, you and I. And let it be a witness between you and me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob took a stone and set it up as a pillar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob said to his kinsmen, “Gather stones.” And they took stones and made a heap, and they ate there by the heap.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Laban called it Jegar-sahadutha, but Jacob called it Galeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Laban said, “This heap is a witness between you and me today.” Therefore he named it Galeed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Mizpah, for he said, “The Lord watch between you and me, when we are out of one another's sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you oppress my daughters, or if you take wives besides my daughters, although no one is with us, see, God is witness between you and me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Laban said to Jacob, “See this heap and the pillar, which I have set between you and me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This heap is a witness, and the pillar is a witness, that I will not pass over this heap to you, and you will not pass over this heap and this pillar to me, to do harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of Abraham and the God of Nahor, the God of their father, judge between us.” So Jacob swore by the Fear of his father Isaac,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jacob offered a sacrifice in the hill country and called his kinsmen to eat bread. They ate bread and spent the night in the hill country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early in the morning Laban arose and kissed his grandchildren and his daughters and blessed them. Then Laban departed and returned home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob went on his way, and the angels of God met him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jacob saw them he said, “This is God's camp!” So he called the name of that place Mahanaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob sent messengers before him to Esau his brother in the land of Seir, the country of Edom,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: instructing them, “Thus you shall say to my lord Esau: Thus says your servant Jacob, ‘I have sojourned with Laban and stayed until now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have oxen, donkeys, flocks, male servants, and female servants. I have sent to tell my lord, in order that I may find favor in your sight.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the messengers returned to Jacob, saying, “We came to your brother Esau, and he is coming to meet you, and there are four hundred men with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob was greatly afraid and distressed. He divided the people who were with him, and the flocks and herds and camels, into two camps,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thinking, “If Esau comes to the one camp and attacks it, then the camp that is left will escape.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob said, “O God of my father Abraham and God of my father Isaac, O Lord who said to me, ‘Return to your country and to your kindred, that I may do you good,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am not worthy of the least of all the deeds of steadfast love and all the faithfulness that you have shown to your servant, for with only my staff I crossed this Jordan, and now I have become two camps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please deliver me from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau, for I fear him, that he may come and attack me, the mothers with the children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you said, ‘I will surely do you good, and make your offspring as the sand of the sea, which cannot be numbered for multitude.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he stayed there that night, and from what he had with him he took a present for his brother Esau,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: two hundred female goats and twenty male goats, two hundred ewes and twenty rams,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thirty milking camels and their calves, forty cows and ten bulls, twenty female donkeys and ten male donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These he handed over to his servants, every drove by itself, and said to his servants, “Pass on ahead of me and put a space between drove and drove.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He instructed the first, “When Esau my brother meets you and asks you, ‘To whom do you belong? Where are you going? And whose are these ahead of you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall say, ‘They belong to your servant Jacob. They are a present sent to my lord Esau. And moreover, he is behind us.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He likewise instructed the second and the third and all who followed the droves, “You shall say the same thing to Esau when you find him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall say, ‘Moreover, your servant Jacob is behind us.’” For he thought, “I may appease him with the present that goes ahead of me, and afterward I shall see his face. Perhaps he will accept me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the present passed on ahead of him, and he himself stayed that night in the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same night he arose and took his two wives, his two female servants, and his eleven children, and crossed the ford of the Jabbok.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took them and sent them across the stream, and everything else that he had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob was left alone. And a man wrestled with him until the breaking of the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the man saw that he did not prevail against Jacob, he touched his hip socket, and Jacob's hip was put out of joint as he wrestled with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Let me go, for the day has broken.” But Jacob said, “I will not let you go unless you bless me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “What is your name?” And he said, “Jacob.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Your name shall no longer be called Jacob, but Israel, for you have striven with God and with men, and have prevailed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob asked him, “Please tell me your name.” But he said, “Why is it that you ask my name?” And there he blessed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob called the name of the place Peniel, saying, “For I have seen God face to face, and yet my life has been delivered.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sun rose upon him as he passed Penuel, limping because of his hip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore to this day the people of Israel do not eat the sinew of the thigh that is on the hip socket, because he touched the socket of Jacob's hip on the sinew of the thigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob lifted up his eyes and looked, and behold, Esau was coming, and four hundred men with him. So he divided the children among Leah and Rachel and the two female servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put the servants with their children in front, then Leah with her children, and Rachel and Joseph last of all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He himself went on before them, bowing himself to the ground seven times, until he came near to his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Esau ran to meet him and embraced him and fell on his neck and kissed him, and they wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Esau lifted up his eyes and saw the women and children, he said, “Who are these with you?” Jacob said, “The children whom God has graciously given your servant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the servants drew near, they and their children, and bowed down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leah likewise and her children drew near and bowed down. And last Joseph and Rachel drew near, and they bowed down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Esau said, “What do you mean by all this company that I met?” Jacob answered, “To find favor in the sight of my lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Esau said, “I have enough, my brother; keep what you have for yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob said, “No, please, if I have found favor in your sight, then accept my present from my hand. For I have seen your face, which is like seeing the face of God, and you have accepted me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please accept my blessing that is brought to you, because God has dealt graciously with me, and because I have enough.” Thus he urged him, and he took it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Esau said, “Let us journey on our way, and I will go ahead of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jacob said to him, “My lord knows that the children are frail, and that the nursing flocks and herds are a care to me. If they are driven hard for one day, all the flocks will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let my lord pass on ahead of his servant, and I will lead on slowly, at the pace of the livestock that are ahead of me and at the pace of the children, until I come to my lord in Seir.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Esau said, “Let me leave with you some of the people who are with me.” But he said, “What need is there? Let me find favor in the sight of my lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Esau returned that day on his way to Seir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jacob journeyed to Succoth, and built himself a house and made booths for his livestock. Therefore the name of the place is called Succoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob came safely to the city of Shechem, which is in the land of Canaan, on his way from Paddan-aram, and he camped before the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from the sons of Hamor, Shechem's father, he bought for a hundred pieces of money the piece of land on which he had pitched his tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There he erected an altar and called it El-Elohe-Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Dinah the daughter of Leah, whom she had borne to Jacob, went out to see the women of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite, the prince of the land, saw her, he seized her and lay with her and humiliated her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his soul was drawn to Dinah the daughter of Jacob. He loved the young woman and spoke tenderly to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Shechem spoke to his father Hamor, saying, “Get me this girl for my wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jacob heard that he had defiled his daughter Dinah. But his sons were with his livestock in the field, so Jacob held his peace until they came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hamor the father of Shechem went out to Jacob to speak with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jacob had come in from the field as soon as they heard of it, and the men were indignant and very angry, because he had done an outrageous thing in Israel by lying with Jacob's daughter, for such a thing must not be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Hamor spoke with them, saying, “The soul of my son Shechem longs for your daughter. Please give her to him to be his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make marriages with us. Give your daughters to us, and take our daughters for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall dwell with us, and the land shall be open to you. Dwell and trade in it, and get property in it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shechem also said to her father and to her brothers, “Let me find favor in your eyes, and whatever you say to me I will give.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ask me for as great a bride-price and gift as you will, and I will give whatever you say to me. Only give me the young woman to be my wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jacob answered Shechem and his father Hamor deceitfully, because he had defiled their sister Dinah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to them, “We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to one who is uncircumcised, for that would be a disgrace to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only on this condition will we agree with you—that you will become as we are by every male among you being circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we will give our daughters to you, and we will take your daughters to ourselves, and we will dwell with you and become one people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you will not listen to us and be circumcised, then we will take our daughter, and we will be gone.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their words pleased Hamor and Hamor's son Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the young man did not delay to do the thing, because he delighted in Jacob's daughter. Now he was the most honored of all his father's house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Hamor and his son Shechem came to the gate of their city and spoke to the men of their city, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These men are at peace with us; let them dwell in the land and trade in it, for behold, the land is large enough for them. Let us take their daughters as wives, and let us give them our daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only on this condition will the men agree to dwell with us to become one people—when every male among us is circumcised as they are circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will not their livestock, their property and all their beasts be ours? Only let us agree with them, and they will dwell with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all who went out of the gate of his city listened to Hamor and his son Shechem, and every male was circumcised, all who went out of the gate of his city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the third day, when they were sore, two of the sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, Dinah's brothers, took their swords and came against the city while it felt secure and killed all the males.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They killed Hamor and his son Shechem with the sword and took Dinah out of Shechem's house and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jacob came upon the slain and plundered the city, because they had defiled their sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator
