verses.text: They took their flocks and their herds, their donkeys, and whatever was in the city and in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All their wealth, all their little ones and their wives, all that was in the houses, they captured and plundered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, “You have brought trouble on me by making me stink to the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites and the Perizzites. My numbers are few, and if they gather themselves against me and attack me, I shall be destroyed, both I and my household.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said, “Should he treat our sister like a prostitute?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God said to Jacob, “Arise, go up to Bethel and dwell there. Make an altar there to the God who appeared to you when you fled from your brother Esau.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob said to his household and to all who were with him, “Put away the foreign gods that are among you and purify yourselves and change your garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then let us arise and go up to Bethel, so that I may make there an altar to the God who answers me in the day of my distress and has been with me wherever I have gone.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they gave to Jacob all the foreign gods that they had, and the rings that were in their ears. Jacob hid them under the terebinth tree that was near Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they journeyed, a terror from God fell upon the cities that were around them, so that they did not pursue the sons of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob came to Luz (that is, Bethel), which is in the land of Canaan, he and all the people who were with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there he built an altar and called the place El-bethel, because there God had revealed himself to him when he fled from his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Deborah, Rebekah's nurse, died, and she was buried under an oak below Bethel. So he called its name Allon-bacuth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God appeared to Jacob again, when he came from Paddan-aram, and blessed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said to him, “Your name is Jacob; no longer shall your name be called Jacob, but Israel shall be your name.” So he called his name Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said to him, “I am God Almighty: be fruitful and multiply. A nation and a company of nations shall come from you, and kings shall come from your own body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land that I gave to Abraham and Isaac I will give to you, and I will give the land to your offspring after you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God went up from him in the place where he had spoken with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob set up a pillar in the place where he had spoken with him, a pillar of stone. He poured out a drink offering on it and poured oil on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob called the name of the place where God had spoken with him Bethel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they journeyed from Bethel. When they were still some distance from Ephrath, Rachel went into labor, and she had hard labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when her labor was at its hardest, the midwife said to her, “Do not fear, for you have another son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as her soul was departing (for she was dying), she called his name Ben-oni; but his father called him Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Rachel died, and she was buried on the way to Ephrath (that is, Bethlehem),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jacob set up a pillar over her tomb. It is the pillar of Rachel's tomb, which is there to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel journeyed on and pitched his tent beyond the tower of Eder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
While Israel lived in that land, Reuben went and lay with Bilhah his father's concubine. And Israel heard of it.
Now the sons of Jacob were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Leah: Reuben (Jacob's firstborn), Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Bilhah, Rachel's servant: Dan and Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Zilpah, Leah's servant: Gad and Asher. These were the sons of Jacob who were born to him in Paddan-aram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob came to his father Isaac at Mamre, or Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron), where Abraham and Isaac had sojourned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the days of Isaac were 180 years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaac breathed his last, and he died and was gathered to his people, old and full of days. And his sons Esau and Jacob buried him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the generations of Esau (that is, Edom).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Esau took his wives from the Canaanites: Adah the daughter of Elon the Hittite, Oholibamah the daughter of Anah the daughter of Zibeon the Hivite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Basemath, Ishmael's daughter, the sister of Nebaioth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Adah bore to Esau, Eliphaz; Basemath bore Reuel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Oholibamah bore Jeush, Jalam, and Korah. These are the sons of Esau who were born to him in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Esau took his wives, his sons, his daughters, and all the members of his household, his livestock, all his beasts, and all his property that he had acquired in the land of Canaan. He went into a land away from his brother Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For their possessions were too great for them to dwell together. The land of their sojournings could not support them because of their livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Esau settled in the hill country of Seir. (Esau is Edom.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the generations of Esau the father of the Edomites in the hill country of Seir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of Esau's sons: Eliphaz the son of Adah the wife of Esau, Reuel the son of Basemath the wife of Esau.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, and Kenaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Timna was a concubine of Eliphaz, Esau's son; she bore Amalek to Eliphaz.) These are the sons of Adah, Esau's wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah. These are the sons of Basemath, Esau's wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Oholibamah the daughter of Anah the daughter of Zibeon, Esau's wife: she bore to Esau Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the chiefs of the sons of Esau. The sons of Eliphaz the firstborn of Esau: the chiefs Teman, Omar, Zepho, Kenaz,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Korah, Gatam, and Amalek; these are the chiefs of Eliphaz in the land of Edom; these are the sons of Adah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Reuel, Esau's son: the chiefs Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah; these are the chiefs of Reuel in the land of Edom; these are the sons of Basemath, Esau's wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Oholibamah, Esau's wife: the chiefs Jeush, Jalam, and Korah; these are the chiefs born of Oholibamah the daughter of Anah, Esau's wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Esau (that is, Edom), and these are their chiefs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Seir the Horite, the inhabitants of the land: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan; these are the chiefs of the Horites, the sons of Seir in the land of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Lotan were Hori and Hemam; and Lotan's sister was Timna.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Shobal: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah; he is the Anah who found the hot springs in the wilderness, as he pastured the donkeys of Zibeon his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the children of Anah: Dishon and Oholibamah the daughter of Anah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Dishon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the chiefs of the Horites: the chiefs Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan; these are the chiefs of the Horites, chief by chief in the land of Seir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom, before any king reigned over the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bela the son of Beor reigned in Edom, the name of his city being Dinhabah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bela died, and Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jobab died, and Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Husham died, and Hadad the son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the country of Moab, reigned in his place, the name of his city being Avith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hadad died, and Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Samlah died, and Shaul of Rehoboth on the Euphrates reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shaul died, and Baal-hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Baal-hanan the son of Achbor died, and Hadar reigned in his place, the name of his city being Pau; his wife's name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, daughter of Mezahab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the chiefs of Esau, according to their clans and their dwelling places, by their names: the chiefs Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Magdiel, and Iram; these are the chiefs of Edom (that is, Esau, the father of Edom), according to their dwelling places in the land of their possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob lived in the land of his father's sojournings, in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These are the generations of Jacob.
Joseph, being seventeen years old, was pasturing the flock with his brothers. He was a boy with the sons of Bilhah and Zilpah, his father's wives. And Joseph brought a bad report of them to their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Israel loved Joseph more than any other of his sons, because he was the son of his old age. And he made him a robe of many colors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when his brothers saw that their father loved him more than all his brothers, they hated him and could not speak peacefully to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joseph had a dream, and when he told it to his brothers they hated him even more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Hear this dream that I have dreamed:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and behold, my sheaf arose and stood upright. And behold, your sheaves gathered around it and bowed down to my sheaf.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His brothers said to him, “Are you indeed to reign over us? Or are you indeed to rule over us?” So they hated him even more for his dreams and for his words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he dreamed another dream and told it to his brothers and said, “Behold, I have dreamed another dream. Behold, the sun, the moon, and eleven stars were bowing down to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he told it to his father and to his brothers, his father rebuked him and said to him, “What is this dream that you have dreamed? Shall I and your mother and your brothers indeed come to bow ourselves to the ground before you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his brothers were jealous of him, but his father kept the saying in mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now his brothers went to pasture their father's flock near Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel said to Joseph, “Are not your brothers pasturing the flock at Shechem? Come, I will send you to them.” And he said to him, “Here I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to him, “Go now, see if it is well with your brothers and with the flock, and bring me word.” So he sent him from the Valley of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a man found him wandering in the fields. And the man asked him, “What are you seeking?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am seeking my brothers,” he said. “Tell me, please, where they are pasturing the flock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man said, “They have gone away, for I heard them say, ‘Let us go to Dothan.’” So Joseph went after his brothers and found them at Dothan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They saw him from afar, and before he came near to them they conspired against him to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to one another, “Here comes this dreamer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come now, let us kill him and throw him into one of the pits. Then we will say that a fierce animal has devoured him, and we will see what will become of his dreams.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Reuben heard it, he rescued him out of their hands, saying, “Let us not take his life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Reuben said to them, “Shed no blood; throw him into this pit here in the wilderness, but do not lay a hand on him”—that he might rescue him out of their hand to restore him to his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Joseph came to his brothers, they stripped him of his robe, the robe of many colors that he wore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took him and threw him into a pit. The pit was empty; there was no water in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they sat down to eat. And looking up they saw a caravan of Ishmaelites coming from Gilead, with their camels bearing gum, balm, and myrrh, on their way to carry it down to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judah said to his brothers, “What profit is it if we kill our brother and conceal his blood?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come, let us sell him to the Ishmaelites, and let not our hand be upon him, for he is our brother, our own flesh.” And his brothers listened to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Midianite traders passed by. And they drew Joseph up and lifted him out of the pit, and sold him to the Ishmaelites for twenty shekels of silver. They took Joseph to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Reuben returned to the pit and saw that Joseph was not in the pit, he tore his clothes
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and returned to his brothers and said, “The boy is gone, and I, where shall I go?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they took Joseph's robe and slaughtered a goat and dipped the robe in the blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they sent the robe of many colors and brought it to their father and said, “This we have found; please identify whether it is your son's robe or not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he identified it and said, “It is my son's robe. A fierce animal has devoured him. Joseph is without doubt torn to pieces.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob tore his garments and put sackcloth on his loins and mourned for his son many days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All his sons and all his daughters rose up to comfort him, but he refused to be comforted and said, “No, I shall go down to Sheol to my son, mourning.” Thus his father wept for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile the Midianites had sold him in Egypt to Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh, the captain of the guard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened at that time that Judah went down from his brothers and turned aside to a certain Adullamite, whose name was Hirah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There Judah saw the daughter of a certain Canaanite whose name was Shua. He took her and went in to her,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she conceived and bore a son, and he called his name Er.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She conceived again and bore a son, and she called his name Onan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet again she bore a son, and she called his name Shelah. Judah was in Chezib when she bore him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judah took a wife for Er his firstborn, and her name was Tamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Er, Judah's firstborn, was wicked in the sight of the Lord, and the Lord put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judah said to Onan, “Go in to your brother's wife and perform the duty of a brother-in-law to her, and raise up offspring for your brother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Onan knew that the offspring would not be his. So whenever he went in to his brother's wife he would waste the semen on the ground, so as not to give offspring to his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what he did was wicked in the sight of the Lord, and he put him to death also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judah said to Tamar his daughter-in-law, “Remain a widow in your father's house, till Shelah my son grows up”—for he feared that he would die, like his brothers. So Tamar went and remained in her father's house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the course of time the wife of Judah, Shua's daughter, died. When Judah was comforted, he went up to Timnah to his sheepshearers, he and his friend Hirah the Adullamite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Tamar was told, “Your father-in-law is going up to Timnah to shear his sheep,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: she took off her widow's garments and covered herself with a veil, wrapping herself up, and sat at the entrance to Enaim, which is on the road to Timnah. For she saw that Shelah was grown up, and she had not been given to him in marriage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Judah saw her, he thought she was a prostitute, for she had covered her face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He turned to her at the roadside and said, “Come, let me come in to you,” for he did not know that she was his daughter-in-law. She said, “What will you give me, that you may come in to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “I will send you a young goat from the flock.” And she said, “If you give me a pledge, until you send it—”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “What pledge shall I give you?” She replied, “Your signet and your cord and your staff that is in your hand.” So he gave them to her and went in to her, and she conceived by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she arose and went away, and taking off her veil she put on the garments of her widowhood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Judah sent the young goat by his friend the Adullamite to take back the pledge from the woman's hand, he did not find her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he asked the men of the place, “Where is the cult prostitute who was at Enaim at the roadside?” And they said, “No cult prostitute has been here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he returned to Judah and said, “I have not found her. Also, the men of the place said, ‘No cult prostitute has been here.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judah replied, “Let her keep the things as her own, or we shall be laughed at. You see, I sent this young goat, and you did not find her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About three months later Judah was told, “Tamar your daughter-in-law has been immoral. Moreover, she is pregnant by immorality.” And Judah said, “Bring her out, and let her be burned.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As she was being brought out, she sent word to her father-in-law, “By the man to whom these belong, I am pregnant.” And she said, “Please identify whose these are, the signet and the cord and the staff.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judah identified them and said, “She is more righteous than I, since I did not give her to my son Shelah.” And he did not know her again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the time of her labor came, there were twins in her womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she was in labor, one put out a hand, and the midwife took and tied a scarlet thread on his hand, saying, “This one came out first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as he drew back his hand, behold, his brother came out. And she said, “What a breach you have made for yourself!” Therefore his name was called Perez.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward his brother came out with the scarlet thread on his hand, and his name was called Zerah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joseph had been brought down to Egypt, and Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh, the captain of the guard, an Egyptian, had bought him from the Ishmaelites who had brought him down there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord was with Joseph, and he became a successful man, and he was in the house of his Egyptian master.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His master saw that the Lord was with him and that the Lord caused all that he did to succeed in his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph found favor in his sight and attended him, and he made him overseer of his house and put him in charge of all that he had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the time that he made him overseer in his house and over all that he had, the Lord blessed the Egyptian's house for Joseph's sake; the blessing of the Lord was on all that he had, in house and field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he left all that he had in Joseph's charge, and because of him he had no concern about anything but the food he ate.
Now Joseph was handsome in form and appearance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after a time his master's wife cast her eyes on Joseph and said, “Lie with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he refused and said to his master's wife, “Behold, because of me my master has no concern about anything in the house, and he has put everything that he has in my charge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not greater in this house than I am, nor has he kept back anything from me except you, because you are his wife. How then can I do this great wickedness and sin against God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as she spoke to Joseph day after day, he would not listen to her, to lie beside her or to be with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one day, when he went into the house to do his work and none of the men of the house was there in the house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: she caught him by his garment, saying, “Lie with me.” But he left his garment in her hand and fled and got out of the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as she saw that he had left his garment in her hand and had fled out of the house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: she called to the men of her household and said to them, “See, he has brought among us a Hebrew to laugh at us. He came in to me to lie with me, and I cried out with a loud voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as he heard that I lifted up my voice and cried out, he left his garment beside me and fled and got out of the house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she laid up his garment by her until his master came home,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she told him the same story, saying, “The Hebrew servant, whom you have brought among us, came in to me to laugh at me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as soon as I lifted up my voice and cried, he left his garment beside me and fled out of the house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as his master heard the words that his wife spoke to him, “This is the way your servant treated me,” his anger was kindled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph's master took him and put him into the prison, the place where the king's prisoners were confined, and he was there in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord was with Joseph and showed him steadfast love and gave him favor in the sight of the keeper of the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the keeper of the prison put Joseph in charge of all the prisoners who were in the prison. Whatever was done there, he was the one who did it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The keeper of the prison paid no attention to anything that was in Joseph's charge, because the Lord was with him. And whatever he did, the Lord made it succeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some time after this, the cupbearer of the king of Egypt and his baker committed an offense against their lord the king of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh was angry with his two officers, the chief cupbearer and the chief baker,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he put them in custody in the house of the captain of the guard, in the prison where Joseph was confined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The captain of the guard appointed Joseph to be with them, and he attended them. They continued for some time in custody.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one night they both dreamed—the cupbearer and the baker of the king of Egypt, who were confined in the prison—each his own dream, and each dream with its own interpretation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joseph came to them in the morning, he saw that they were troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he asked Pharaoh's officers who were with him in custody in his master's house, “Why are your faces downcast today?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “We have had dreams, and there is no one to interpret them.” And Joseph said to them, “Do not interpretations belong to God? Please tell them to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the chief cupbearer told his dream to Joseph and said to him, “In my dream there was a vine before me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on the vine there were three branches. As soon as it budded, its blossoms shot forth, and the clusters ripened into grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh's cup was in my hand, and I took the grapes and pressed them into Pharaoh's cup and placed the cup in Pharaoh's hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph said to him, “This is its interpretation: the three branches are three days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In three days Pharaoh will lift up your head and restore you to your office, and you shall place Pharaoh's cup in his hand as formerly, when you were his cupbearer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only remember me, when it is well with you, and please do me the kindness to mention me to Pharaoh, and so get me out of this house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was indeed stolen out of the land of the Hebrews, and here also I have done nothing that they should put me into the pit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the chief baker saw that the interpretation was favorable, he said to Joseph, “I also had a dream: there were three cake baskets on my head,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the uppermost basket there were all sorts of baked food for Pharaoh, but the birds were eating it out of the basket on my head.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph answered and said, “This is its interpretation: the three baskets are three days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In three days Pharaoh will lift up your head—from you!—and hang you on a tree. And the birds will eat the flesh from you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the third day, which was Pharaoh's birthday, he made a feast for all his servants and lifted up the head of the chief cupbearer and the head of the chief baker among his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He restored the chief cupbearer to his position, and he placed the cup in Pharaoh's hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he hanged the chief baker, as Joseph had interpreted to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the chief cupbearer did not remember Joseph, but forgot him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After two whole years, Pharaoh dreamed that he was standing by the Nile,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and behold, there came up out of the Nile seven cows, attractive and plump, and they fed in the reed grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, seven other cows, ugly and thin, came up out of the Nile after them, and stood by the other cows on the bank of the Nile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the ugly, thin cows ate up the seven attractive, plump cows. And Pharaoh awoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he fell asleep and dreamed a second time. And behold, seven ears of grain, plump and good, were growing on one stalk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, after them sprouted seven ears, thin and blighted by the east wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the thin ears swallowed up the seven plump, full ears. And Pharaoh awoke, and behold, it was a dream.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So in the morning his spirit was troubled, and he sent and called for all the magicians of Egypt and all its wise men. Pharaoh told them his dreams, but there was none who could interpret them to Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief cupbearer said to Pharaoh, “I remember my offenses today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pharaoh was angry with his servants and put me and the chief baker in custody in the house of the captain of the guard,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: we dreamed on the same night, he and I, each having a dream with its own interpretation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A young Hebrew was there with us, a servant of the captain of the guard. When we told him, he interpreted our dreams to us, giving an interpretation to each man according to his dream.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he interpreted to us, so it came about. I was restored to my office, and the baker was hanged.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh sent and called Joseph, and they quickly brought him out of the pit. And when he had shaved himself and changed his clothes, he came in before Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I have had a dream, and there is no one who can interpret it. I have heard it said of you that when you hear a dream you can interpret it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph answered Pharaoh, “It is not in me; God will give Pharaoh a favorable answer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Behold, in my dream I was standing on the banks of the Nile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven cows, plump and attractive, came up out of the Nile and fed in the reed grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven other cows came up after them, poor and very ugly and thin, such as I had never seen in all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the thin, ugly cows ate up the first seven plump cows,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when they had eaten them no one would have known that they had eaten them, for they were still as ugly as at the beginning. Then I awoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also saw in my dream seven ears growing on one stalk, full and good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven ears, withered, thin, and blighted by the east wind, sprouted after them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the thin ears swallowed up the seven good ears. And I told it to the magicians, but there was no one who could explain it to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph said to Pharaoh, “The dreams of Pharaoh are one; God has revealed to Pharaoh what he is about to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seven good cows are seven years, and the seven good ears are seven years; the dreams are one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seven lean and ugly cows that came up after them are seven years, and the seven empty ears blighted by the east wind are also seven years of famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is as I told Pharaoh; God has shown to Pharaoh what he is about to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will come seven years of great plenty throughout all the land of Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but after them there will arise seven years of famine, and all the plenty will be forgotten in the land of Egypt. The famine will consume the land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the plenty will be unknown in the land by reason of the famine that will follow, for it will be very severe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the doubling of Pharaoh's dream means that the thing is fixed by God, and God will shortly bring it about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore let Pharaoh select a discerning and wise man, and set him over the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let Pharaoh proceed to appoint overseers over the land and take one-fifth of the produce of the land of Egypt during the seven plentiful years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let them gather all the food of these good years that are coming and store up grain under the authority of Pharaoh for food in the cities, and let them keep it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That food shall be a reserve for the land against the seven years of famine that are to occur in the land of Egypt, so that the land may not perish through the famine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This proposal pleased Pharaoh and all his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh said to his servants, “Can we find a man like this, in whom is the Spirit of God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Since God has shown you all this, there is none so discerning and wise as you are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall be over my house, and all my people shall order themselves as you command. Only as regards the throne will I be greater than you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh said to Joseph, “See, I have set you over all the land of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh took his signet ring from his hand and put it on Joseph's hand, and clothed him in garments of fine linen and put a gold chain about his neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made him ride in his second chariot. And they called out before him, “Bow the knee!” Thus he set him over all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I am Pharaoh, and without your consent no one shall lift up hand or foot in all the land of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh called Joseph's name Zaphenath-paneah. And he gave him in marriage Asenath, the daughter of Potiphera priest of On. So Joseph went out over the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph was thirty years old when he entered the service of Pharaoh king of Egypt. And Joseph went out from the presence of Pharaoh and went through all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During the seven plentiful years the earth produced abundantly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he gathered up all the food of these seven years, which occurred in the land of Egypt, and put the food in the cities. He put in every city the food from the fields around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph stored up grain in great abundance, like the sand of the sea, until he ceased to measure it, for it could not be measured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before the year of famine came, two sons were born to Joseph. Asenath, the daughter of Potiphera priest of On, bore them to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph called the name of the firstborn Manasseh. “For,” he said, “God has made me forget all my hardship and all my father's house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of the second he called Ephraim, “For God has made me fruitful in the land of my affliction.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seven years of plenty that occurred in the land of Egypt came to an end,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the seven years of famine began to come, as Joseph had said. There was famine in all lands, but in all the land of Egypt there was bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the land of Egypt was famished, the people cried to Pharaoh for bread. Pharaoh said to all the Egyptians, “Go to Joseph. What he says to you, do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the famine had spread over all the land, Joseph opened all the storehouses and sold to the Egyptians, for the famine was severe in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, all the earth came to Egypt to Joseph to buy grain, because the famine was severe over all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jacob learned that there was grain for sale in Egypt, he said to his sons, “Why do you look at one another?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Behold, I have heard that there is grain for sale in Egypt. Go down and buy grain for us there, that we may live and not die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So ten of Joseph's brothers went down to buy grain in Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jacob did not send Benjamin, Joseph's brother, with his brothers, for he feared that harm might happen to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the sons of Israel came to buy among the others who came, for the famine was in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joseph was governor over the land. He was the one who sold to all the people of the land. And Joseph's brothers came and bowed themselves before him with their faces to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph saw his brothers and recognized them, but he treated them like strangers and spoke roughly to them. “Where do you come from?” he said. They said, “From the land of Canaan, to buy food.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph recognized his brothers, but they did not recognize him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph remembered the dreams that he had dreamed of them. And he said to them, “You are spies; you have come to see the nakedness of the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “No, my lord, your servants have come to buy food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are all sons of one man. We are honest men. Your servants have never been spies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “No, it is the nakedness of the land that you have come to see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “We, your servants, are twelve brothers, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan, and behold, the youngest is this day with our father, and one is no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joseph said to them, “It is as I said to you. You are spies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By this you shall be tested: by the life of Pharaoh, you shall not go from this place unless your youngest brother comes here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send one of you, and let him bring your brother, while you remain confined, that your words may be tested, whether there is truth in you. Or else, by the life of Pharaoh, surely you are spies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put them all together in custody for three days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the third day Joseph said to them, “Do this and you will live, for I fear God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you are honest men, let one of your brothers remain confined where you are in custody, and let the rest go and carry grain for the famine of your households,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and bring your youngest brother to me. So your words will be verified, and you shall not die.” And they did so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to one another, “In truth we are guilty concerning our brother, in that we saw the distress of his soul, when he begged us and we did not listen. That is why this distress has come upon us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Reuben answered them, “Did I not tell you not to sin against the boy? But you did not listen. So now there comes a reckoning for his blood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not know that Joseph understood them, for there was an interpreter between them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he turned away from them and wept. And he returned to them and spoke to them. And he took Simeon from them and bound him before their eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph gave orders to fill their bags with grain, and to replace every man's money in his sack, and to give them provisions for the journey. This was done for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they loaded their donkeys with their grain and departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as one of them opened his sack to give his donkey fodder at the lodging place, he saw his money in the mouth of his sack.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to his brothers, “My money has been put back; here it is in the mouth of my sack!” At this their hearts failed them, and they turned trembling to one another, saying, “What is this that God has done to us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to Jacob their father in the land of Canaan, they told him all that had happened to them, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The man, the lord of the land, spoke roughly to us and took us to be spies of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we said to him, ‘We are honest men; we have never been spies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are twelve brothers, sons of our father. One is no more, and the youngest is this day with our father in the land of Canaan.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the man, the lord of the land, said to us, ‘By this I shall know that you are honest men: leave one of your brothers with me, and take grain for the famine of your households, and go your way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring your youngest brother to me. Then I shall know that you are not spies but honest men, and I will deliver your brother to you, and you shall trade in the land.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they emptied their sacks, behold, every man's bundle of money was in his sack. And when they and their father saw their bundles of money, they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob their father said to them, “You have bereaved me of my children: Joseph is no more, and Simeon is no more, and now you would take Benjamin. All this has come against me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Reuben said to his father, “Kill my two sons if I do not bring him back to you. Put him in my hands, and I will bring him back to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “My son shall not go down with you, for his brother is dead, and he is the only one left. If harm should happen to him on the journey that you are to make, you would bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to Sheol.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the famine was severe in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had eaten the grain that they had brought from Egypt, their father said to them, “Go again, buy us a little food.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Judah said to him, “The man solemnly warned us, saying, ‘You shall not see my face unless your brother is with you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you will send our brother with us, we will go down and buy you food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you will not send him, we will not go down, for the man said to us, ‘You shall not see my face, unless your brother is with you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel said, “Why did you treat me so badly as to tell the man that you had another brother?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They replied, “The man questioned us carefully about ourselves and our kindred, saying, ‘Is your father still alive? Do you have another brother?’ What we told him was in answer to these questions. Could we in any way know that he would say, ‘Bring your brother down’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judah said to Israel his father, “Send the boy with me, and we will arise and go, that we may live and not die, both we and you and also our little ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will be a pledge of his safety. From my hand you shall require him. If I do not bring him back to you and set him before you, then let me bear the blame forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we had not delayed, we would now have returned twice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then their father Israel said to them, “If it must be so, then do this: take some of the choice fruits of the land in your bags, and carry a present down to the man, a little balm and a little honey, gum, myrrh, pistachio nuts, and almonds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take double the money with you. Carry back with you the money that was returned in the mouth of your sacks. Perhaps it was an oversight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take also your brother, and arise, go again to the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May God Almighty grant you mercy before the man, and may he send back your other brother and Benjamin. And as for me, if I am bereaved of my children, I am bereaved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the men took this present, and they took double the money with them, and Benjamin. They arose and went down to Egypt and stood before Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to the steward of his house, “Bring the men into the house, and slaughter an animal and make ready, for the men are to dine with me at noon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man did as Joseph told him and brought the men to Joseph's house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men were afraid because they were brought to Joseph's house, and they said, “It is because of the money, which was replaced in our sacks the first time, that we are brought in, so that he may assault us and fall upon us to make us servants and seize our donkeys.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went up to the steward of Joseph's house and spoke with him at the door of the house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Oh, my lord, we came down the first time to buy food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we came to the lodging place we opened our sacks, and there was each man's money in the mouth of his sack, our money in full weight. So we have brought it again with us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we have brought other money down with us to buy food. We do not know who put our money in our sacks.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied, “Peace to you, do not be afraid. Your God and the God of your father has put treasure in your sacks for you. I received your money.” Then he brought Simeon out to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the man had brought the men into Joseph's house and given them water, and they had washed their feet, and when he had given their donkeys fodder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they prepared the present for Joseph's coming at noon, for they heard that they should eat bread there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joseph came home, they brought into the house to him the present that they had with them and bowed down to him to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he inquired about their welfare and said, “Is your father well, the old man of whom you spoke? Is he still alive?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Your servant our father is well; he is still alive.” And they bowed their heads and prostrated themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he lifted up his eyes and saw his brother Benjamin, his mother's son, and said, “Is this your youngest brother, of whom you spoke to me? God be gracious to you, my son!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph hurried out, for his compassion grew warm for his brother, and he sought a place to weep. And he entered his chamber and wept there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he washed his face and came out. And controlling himself he said, “Serve the food.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They served him by himself, and them by themselves, and the Egyptians who ate with him by themselves, because the Egyptians could not eat with the Hebrews, for that is an abomination to the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they sat before him, the firstborn according to his birthright and the youngest according to his youth. And the men looked at one another in amazement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Portions were taken to them from Joseph's table, but Benjamin's portion was five times as much as any of theirs. And they drank and were merry with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he commanded the steward of his house, “Fill the men's sacks with food, as much as they can carry, and put each man's money in the mouth of his sack,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and put my cup, the silver cup, in the mouth of the sack of the youngest, with his money for the grain.” And he did as Joseph told him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as the morning was light, the men were sent away with their donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had gone only a short distance from the city. Now Joseph said to his steward, “Up, follow after the men, and when you overtake them, say to them, ‘Why have you repaid evil for good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it not from this that my lord drinks, and by this that he practices divination? You have done evil in doing this.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he overtook them, he spoke to them these words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Why does my lord speak such words as these? Far be it from your servants to do such a thing!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the money that we found in the mouths of our sacks we brought back to you from the land of Canaan. How then could we steal silver or gold from your lord's house?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whichever of your servants is found with it shall die, and we also will be my lord's servants.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Let it be as you say: he who is found with it shall be my servant, and the rest of you shall be innocent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then each man quickly lowered his sack to the ground, and each man opened his sack.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he searched, beginning with the eldest and ending with the youngest. And the cup was found in Benjamin's sack.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they tore their clothes, and every man loaded his donkey, and they returned to the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Judah and his brothers came to Joseph's house, he was still there. They fell before him to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph said to them, “What deed is this that you have done? Do you not know that a man like me can indeed practice divination?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judah said, “What shall we say to my lord? What shall we speak? Or how can we clear ourselves? God has found out the guilt of your servants; behold, we are my lord's servants, both we and he also in whose hand the cup has been found.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “Far be it from me that I should do so! Only the man in whose hand the cup was found shall be my servant. But as for you, go up in peace to your father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judah went up to him and said, “Oh, my lord, please let your servant speak a word in my lord's ears, and let not your anger burn against your servant, for you are like Pharaoh himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My lord asked his servants, saying, ‘Have you a father, or a brother?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we said to my lord, ‘We have a father, an old man, and a young brother, the child of his old age. His brother is dead, and he alone is left of his mother's children, and his father loves him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you said to your servants, ‘Bring him down to me, that I may set my eyes on him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We said to my lord, ‘The boy cannot leave his father, for if he should leave his father, his father would die.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you said to your servants, ‘Unless your youngest brother comes down with you, you shall not see my face again.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When we went back to your servant my father, we told him the words of my lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when our father said, ‘Go again, buy us a little food,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: we said, ‘We cannot go down. If our youngest brother goes with us, then we will go down. For we cannot see the man's face unless our youngest brother is with us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then your servant my father said to us, ‘You know that my wife bore me two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One left me, and I said, “Surely he has been torn to pieces,” and I have never seen him since.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you take this one also from me, and harm happens to him, you will bring down my gray hairs in evil to Sheol.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now therefore, as soon as I come to your servant my father, and the boy is not with us, then, as his life is bound up in the boy's life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as soon as he sees that the boy is not with us, he will die, and your servants will bring down the gray hairs of your servant our father with sorrow to Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For your servant became a pledge of safety for the boy to my father, saying, ‘If I do not bring him back to you, then I shall bear the blame before my father all my life.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, please let your servant remain instead of the boy as a servant to my lord, and let the boy go back with his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For how can I go back to my father if the boy is not with me? I fear to see the evil that would find my father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph could not control himself before all those who stood by him. He cried, “Make everyone go out from me.” So no one stayed with him when Joseph made himself known to his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he wept aloud, so that the Egyptians heard it, and the household of Pharaoh heard it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph said to his brothers, “I am Joseph! Is my father still alive?” But his brothers could not answer him, for they were dismayed at his presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph said to his brothers, “Come near to me, please.” And they came near. And he said, “I am your brother, Joseph, whom you sold into Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now do not be distressed or angry with yourselves because you sold me here, for God sent me before you to preserve life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the famine has been in the land these two years, and there are yet five years in which there will be neither plowing nor harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God sent me before you to preserve for you a remnant on earth, and to keep alive for you many survivors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it was not you who sent me here, but God. He has made me a father to Pharaoh, and lord of all his house and ruler over all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hurry and go up to my father and say to him, ‘Thus says your son Joseph, God has made me lord of all Egypt. Come down to me; do not tarry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall dwell in the land of Goshen, and you shall be near me, you and your children and your children's children, and your flocks, your herds, and all that you have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There I will provide for you, for there are yet five years of famine to come, so that you and your household, and all that you have, do not come to poverty.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now your eyes see, and the eyes of my brother Benjamin see, that it is my mouth that speaks to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must tell my father of all my honor in Egypt, and of all that you have seen. Hurry and bring my father down here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he fell upon his brother Benjamin's neck and wept, and Benjamin wept upon his neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he kissed all his brothers and wept upon them. After that his brothers talked with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the report was heard in Pharaoh's house, “Joseph's brothers have come,” it pleased Pharaoh and his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Say to your brothers, ‘Do this: load your beasts and go back to the land of Canaan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and take your father and your households, and come to me, and I will give you the best of the land of Egypt, and you shall eat the fat of the land.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Joseph, are commanded to say, ‘Do this: take wagons from the land of Egypt for your little ones and for your wives, and bring your father, and come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have no concern for your goods, for the best of all the land of Egypt is yours.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Israel did so: and Joseph gave them wagons, according to the command of Pharaoh, and gave them provisions for the journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To each and all of them he gave a change of clothes, but to Benjamin he gave three hundred shekels of silver and five changes of clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To his father he sent as follows: ten donkeys loaded with the good things of Egypt, and ten female donkeys loaded with grain, bread, and provision for his father on the journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he sent his brothers away, and as they departed, he said to them, “Do not quarrel on the way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went up out of Egypt and came to the land of Canaan to their father Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they told him, “Joseph is still alive, and he is ruler over all the land of Egypt.” And his heart became numb, for he did not believe them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they told him all the words of Joseph, which he had said to them, and when he saw the wagons that Joseph had sent to carry him, the spirit of their father Jacob revived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel said, “It is enough; Joseph my son is still alive. I will go and see him before I die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Israel took his journey with all that he had and came to Beersheba, and offered sacrifices to the God of his father Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God spoke to Israel in visions of the night and said, “Jacob, Jacob.” And he said, “Here I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “I am God, the God of your father. Do not be afraid to go down to Egypt, for there I will make you into a great nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I myself will go down with you to Egypt, and I will also bring you up again, and Joseph's hand shall close your eyes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob set out from Beersheba. The sons of Israel carried Jacob their father, their little ones, and their wives, in the wagons that Pharaoh had sent to carry him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also took their livestock and their goods, which they had gained in the land of Canaan, and came into Egypt, Jacob and all his offspring with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his sons, and his sons' sons with him, his daughters, and his sons' daughters. All his offspring he brought with him into Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the names of the descendants of Israel, who came into Egypt, Jacob and his sons. Reuben, Jacob's firstborn,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sons of Reuben: Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Simeon: Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Shaul, the son of a Canaanite woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Judah: Er, Onan, Shelah, Perez, and Zerah (but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan); and the sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Issachar: Tola, Puvah, Yob, and Shimron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Zebulun: Sered, Elon, and Jahleel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Leah, whom she bore to Jacob in Paddan-aram, together with his daughter Dinah; altogether his sons and his daughters numbered thirty-three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gad: Ziphion, Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri, Arodi, and Areli.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Asher: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, Beriah, with Serah their sister. And the sons of Beriah: Heber and Malchiel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to Leah his daughter; and these she bore to Jacob—sixteen persons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Rachel, Jacob's wife: Joseph and Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to Joseph in the land of Egypt were born Manasseh and Ephraim, whom Asenath, the daughter of Potiphera the priest of On, bore to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Benjamin: Bela, Becher, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Ehi, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim, and Ard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Rachel, who were born to Jacob—fourteen persons in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Dan: Hushim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Naphtali: Jahzeel, Guni, Jezer, and Shillem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Bilhah, whom Laban gave to Rachel his daughter, and these she bore to Jacob—seven persons in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the persons belonging to Jacob who came into Egypt, who were his own descendants, not including Jacob's sons' wives, were sixty-six persons in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Joseph, who were born to him in Egypt, were two. All the persons of the house of Jacob who came into Egypt were seventy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had sent Judah ahead of him to Joseph to show the way before him in Goshen, and they came into the land of Goshen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph prepared his chariot and went up to meet Israel his father in Goshen. He presented himself to him and fell on his neck and wept on his neck a good while.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel said to Joseph, “Now let me die, since I have seen your face and know that you are still alive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph said to his brothers and to his father's household, “I will go up and tell Pharaoh and will say to him, ‘My brothers and my father's household, who were in the land of Canaan, have come to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men are shepherds, for they have been keepers of livestock, and they have brought their flocks and their herds and all that they have.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pharaoh calls you and says, ‘What is your occupation?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall say, ‘Your servants have been keepers of livestock from our youth even until now, both we and our fathers,’ in order that you may dwell in the land of Goshen, for every shepherd is an abomination to the Egyptians.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph went in and told Pharaoh, “My father and my brothers, with their flocks and herds and all that they possess, have come from the land of Canaan. They are now in the land of Goshen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from among his brothers he took five men and presented them to Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh said to his brothers, “What is your occupation?” And they said to Pharaoh, “Your servants are shepherds, as our fathers were.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Pharaoh, “We have come to sojourn in the land, for there is no pasture for your servants' flocks, for the famine is severe in the land of Canaan. And now, please let your servants dwell in the land of Goshen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Your father and your brothers have come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land of Egypt is before you. Settle your father and your brothers in the best of the land. Let them settle in the land of Goshen, and if you know any able men among them, put them in charge of my livestock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph brought in Jacob his father and stood him before Pharaoh, and Jacob blessed Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh said to Jacob, “How many are the days of the years of your life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob said to Pharaoh, “The days of the years of my sojourning are 130 years. Few and evil have been the days of the years of my life, and they have not attained to the days of the years of the life of my fathers in the days of their sojourning.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob blessed Pharaoh and went out from the presence of Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph settled his father and his brothers and gave them a possession in the land of Egypt, in the best of the land, in the land of Rameses, as Pharaoh had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph provided his father, his brothers, and all his father's household with food, according to the number of their dependents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was no food in all the land, for the famine was very severe, so that the land of Egypt and the land of Canaan languished by reason of the famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph gathered up all the money that was found in the land of Egypt and in the land of Canaan, in exchange for the grain that they bought. And Joseph brought the money into Pharaoh's house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the money was all spent in the land of Egypt and in the land of Canaan, all the Egyptians came to Joseph and said, “Give us food. Why should we die before your eyes? For our money is gone.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph answered, “Give your livestock, and I will give you food in exchange for your livestock, if your money is gone.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they brought their livestock to Joseph, and Joseph gave them food in exchange for the horses, the flocks, the herds, and the donkeys. He supplied them with food in exchange for all their livestock that year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when that year was ended, they came to him the following year and said to him, “We will not hide from my lord that our money is all spent. The herds of livestock are my lord's. There is nothing left in the sight of my lord but our bodies and our land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should we die before your eyes, both we and our land? Buy us and our land for food, and we with our land will be servants to Pharaoh. And give us seed that we may live and not die, and that the land may not be desolate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph bought all the land of Egypt for Pharaoh, for all the Egyptians sold their fields, because the famine was severe on them. The land became Pharaoh's.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the people, he made servants of them from one end of Egypt to the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only the land of the priests he did not buy, for the priests had a fixed allowance from Pharaoh and lived on the allowance that Pharaoh gave them; therefore they did not sell their land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph said to the people, “Behold, I have this day bought you and your land for Pharaoh. Now here is seed for you, and you shall sow the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at the harvests you shall give a fifth to Pharaoh, and four fifths shall be your own, as seed for the field and as food for yourselves and your households, and as food for your little ones.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “You have saved our lives; may it please my lord, we will be servants to Pharaoh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph made it a statute concerning the land of Egypt, and it stands to this day, that Pharaoh should have the fifth; the land of the priests alone did not become Pharaoh's.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Israel settled in the land of Egypt, in the land of Goshen. And they gained possessions in it, and were fruitful and multiplied greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob lived in the land of Egypt seventeen years. So the days of Jacob, the years of his life, were 147 years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the time drew near that Israel must die, he called his son Joseph and said to him, “If now I have found favor in your sight, put your hand under my thigh and promise to deal kindly and truly with me. Do not bury me in Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but let me lie with my fathers. Carry me out of Egypt and bury me in their burying place.” He answered, “I will do as you have said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Swear to me”; and he swore to him. Then Israel bowed himself upon the head of his bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Joseph was told, “Behold, your father is ill.” So he took with him his two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was told to Jacob, “Your son Joseph has come to you.” Then Israel summoned his strength and sat up in bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob said to Joseph, “God Almighty appeared to me at Luz in the land of Canaan and blessed me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to me, ‘Behold, I will make you fruitful and multiply you, and I will make of you a company of peoples and will give this land to your offspring after you for an everlasting possession.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now your two sons, who were born to you in the land of Egypt before I came to you in Egypt, are mine; Ephraim and Manasseh shall be mine, as Reuben and Simeon are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children that you fathered after them shall be yours. They shall be called by the name of their brothers in their inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for me, when I came from Paddan, to my sorrow Rachel died in the land of Canaan on the way, when there was still some distance to go to Ephrath, and I buried her there on the way to Ephrath (that is, Bethlehem).”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Israel saw Joseph's sons, he said, “Who are these?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph said to his father, “They are my sons, whom God has given me here.” And he said, “Bring them to me, please, that I may bless them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the eyes of Israel were dim with age, so that he could not see. So Joseph brought them near him, and he kissed them and embraced them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel said to Joseph, “I never expected to see your face; and behold, God has let me see your offspring also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph removed them from his knees, and he bowed himself with his face to the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph took them both, Ephraim in his right hand toward Israel's left hand, and Manasseh in his left hand toward Israel's right hand, and brought them near him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel stretched out his right hand and laid it on the head of Ephraim, who was the younger, and his left hand on the head of Manasseh, crossing his hands (for Manasseh was the firstborn).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he blessed Joseph and said,
“The God before whom my fathers Abraham and Isaac walked,
    the God who has been my shepherd all my life long to this day,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: When Joseph saw that his father laid his right hand on the head of Ephraim, it displeased him, and he took his father's hand to move it from Ephraim's head to Manasseh's head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph said to his father, “Not this way, my father; since this one is the firstborn, put your right hand on his head.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his father refused and said, “I know, my son, I know. He also shall become a people, and he also shall be great. Nevertheless, his younger brother shall be greater than he, and his offspring shall become a multitude of nations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he blessed them that day, saying,
“By you Israel will pronounce blessings, saying,
‘God make you as Ephraim and as Manasseh.’”
Thus he put Ephraim before Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Israel said to Joseph, “Behold, I am about to die, but God will be with you and will bring you again to the land of your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, I have given to you rather than to your brothers one mountain slope that I took from the hand of the Amorites with my sword and with my bow.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob called his sons and said, “Gather yourselves together, that I may tell you what shall happen to you in days to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Assemble and listen, O sons of Jacob,
    listen to Israel your father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Reuben, you are my firstborn,
    my might, and the firstfruits of my strength,
    preeminent in dignity and preeminent in power.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Simeon and Levi are brothers;
    weapons of violence are their swords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my soul come not into their council;
    O my glory, be not joined to their company.
For in their anger they killed men,
    and in their willfulness they hamstrung oxen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cursed be their anger, for it is fierce,
    and their wrath, for it is cruel!
I will divide them in Jacob
    and scatter them in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Judah is a lion's cub;
    from the prey, my son, you have gone up.
He stooped down; he crouched as a lion
    and as a lioness; who dares rouse him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The scepter shall not depart from Judah,
    nor the ruler's staff from between his feet,
until tribute comes to him;
    and to him shall be the obedience of the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Binding his foal to the vine
    and his donkey's colt to the choice vine,
he has washed his garments in wine
    and his vesture in the blood of grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His eyes are darker than wine,
    and his teeth whiter than milk.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Issachar is a strong donkey,
    crouching between the sheepfolds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He saw that a resting place was good,
    and that the land was pleasant,
so he bowed his shoulder to bear,
    and became a servant at forced labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Dan shall judge his people
    as one of the tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Dan shall be a serpent in the way,
    a viper by the path,
that bites the horse's heels
    so that his rider falls backward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wait for your salvation, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Raiders shall raid Gad,
    but he shall raid at their heels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Asher's food shall be rich,
    and he shall yield royal delicacies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Naphtali is a doe let loose
    that bears beautiful fawns.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The archers bitterly attacked him,
    shot at him, and harassed him severely,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
yet his bow remained unmoved;
    his arms were made agile
by the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob
    (from there is the Shepherd, the Stone of Israel),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
by the God of your father who will help you,
    by the Almighty who will bless you
    with blessings of heaven above,
blessings of the deep that crouches beneath,
    blessings of the breasts and of the womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The blessings of your father
    are mighty beyond the blessings of my parents,
